J. , tiene la edad de 26 años , habita en el reparto Juan Ramón Padilla , junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como despachadora de una tienda , para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen un hijo de dos años a su cargo , los planes hacia su familia es poder construir su vivienda , ya que actualmente habita en un cuarto que le dio su mamá , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es que su salario no le ajusta para realizar la compra de materiales de construcción de una sola vez , el joven Marlon desde hace tres años labora como bombero en el municipio de Ticuantepe , agradece a Afodenic por la confianza y el apoyo con su primer aprobación de su préstamo . El cual va a invertir en materiales de construcción como: piedra, cemento, arena, hierro, zinc y poder comenzar a construir.
texts.en:
The young man Marlon Antonio A. J. is 26 years old and lives in the town of Juan Ramon Padilla with his wife. He works as a dispatcher for a store in order to support their household expenses. They have a two-year-old son, and their plan is to build a house, because right now they live in a room that his mom gave them. The biggest challenge is that his salary has not been raised in order to purchase construction materials this one time. Marlon also works as a firefighter in the town of Ticuantepe for the past 3 years. He thanks Afodenic for the trust and support given with his first approved loan. He will use it to invest in building materials such as stone, cement, sand, iron, zinc and will be able to start building their home.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stone, sand, cement, iron, zinc and other materials to begin building his house

loans.name: Simeon

texts.en: Simeon, a resident of Ughelli, Delta State, Nigeria, is 38 years old and married with three children. His youngest child is just two weeks old and he is very happy about his new baby.  Simeon sells electrical materials at retail prices to his customers and one day hopes to own a big electrical shop.  He is requesting a loan of 65,000 NGN to purchase more electrical materials to sell. Simeon says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more electrical materials to sell

loans.name: Morrison

texts.en:
Morrison K. is 52 years old and has one child with his wife Joyce K.. He has been in the clothing business for the last four years. Morrison has just applied for a loan from KADET, the only micro-finance institution he has ever done business with. He learned about KADET through various marketing and promotion activities carried out by people in Naivasha town, where he lives.

Morrison will use this loan to increase his stock of items, such as pants and shirts, in order to meet high demand during the Christmas season. His future goal is to own his own boutique.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell to customers during the holidays season

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen, 43 years old, is married and has three children who are all currently in school. Ellen lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a touristy coastal community in the central region of Ghana. The major occupation of the local people is fishing.

Ellen is a merchant. She runs a provisions store by the roadside in the community. She procures her goods from Accra. According to Ellen, she has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy provisions

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Yorn M. is a villager in Mreah Prov village in Takeo province. She is a mother of three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other is a laborer. Her husband, Mr. Nop Puoy, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. He is shown on the left of the photo.
Mrs. Yorn M. is a silk weaver who makes a small income to support her family. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it and has asked for a loan to buy more silk and another raw material to weave.

loans.use: To buy more silk and another raw material to weave

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: Amy G. est une femme de 48 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de PALENE de 3 ans et demi. l'objectif de son crédit est de renforcer sa boutique en marchandises diverses tel que du riz, du sucre, de l'huile etc.. afin de réaliser des bénéfices qui lui permettront de contribuer à la prise en charge de sa famille
texts.en:
Amy G. is a 48-year-old married mother of 4 children. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" (Village loan group) of Palene for 3 and a half years. The goal of this loan is to increase her store's stock of various merchandise such as rice, sugar, oil, etc. in order to realize a profit that will allow her to contribute to taking care of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen and develop her commercial activity

loans.name: Mrs. Shinang Uom Village Bank Group

texts.en: This group loan, which consists of 17 people, is located in Akreiy Ksat village in Kandal province. Mrs. Shinang U. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. They all will use the loan for different purposes. She is a vegetable seller in the local market and her husband, Mr. Poura Mum, is a construction laborer. They can earn less money; however, this family tries to work hard with their careers. So in order to improve their family's living condition, Mrs. Shinang U. decided to ask for a loan to buy more vegetables to re-sell to expand her business. She is a mother of three children. Two of her children are enrolled in local public school and the other one helps the parents. Mrs. Sovana Oruch is the group guarantor.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to re-sell

loans.name: Galina

texts.en: Galina is married and has two grown-up children. She sells clothing - mainly women's hats and scarves - at Krytiy market in Zaporozhye city. There is very little competition for the type of clothing she sells. Galina attracts her clients with the variety and good quality of her inventory. Galina would like to receive a loan of 12,100 hyrvnia to purchase spring inventory. She loves her business and gets help from her son, who makes trips to the Kharkov bulk market to purchase goods.

loans.use: To purchase spring inventory

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en: Timothy is a 35-year-old man, married and blessed with two children. He distributes bread to retail shops in his residential area.  He has been operating this business for three years and he has one employee.  He has managed to build rental houses to rent in order to increase his income. Since he became a member of Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save his money. He hopes to expand his business and to sell poultry products. He dreams of starting a bakery and building a house for his family in the future.  He has requested a loan of Kes 50,000 to start a bakery and buy bakery equipment.  He describes himself as ambitious and hardworking.

loans.use: To start a bakery

loans.name: Twegate B Kayesu Annet Group

texts.en:
Annet K. is a 22-year-old business lady. She is married with two children, of whom one is going to school, and she has two other dependents schooling too. She has been dealing in the clothing business for five years so far. 

She is using the loan to purchase clothes from different towns to bring to Kisekende for sale. She is adding stock, which is improving her business. Her future hope is to work very hard for the welfare of her family, especially the children.

loans.use: To purchase clothes from different towns to bring to Kisekende trading center for sale

loans.name: Marilyn's Group

texts.en:
Marilyn D. is from the village of Sta. Cruz, Alicia, Isabela. She is 41 years old. Marilyn is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Marilyn is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Marilyn owns & operates a general store selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Marilyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.
In 2005, Marilyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Marilyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov C., 37, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for clay and ceramic products. 

She buys lotus seeds for sale for an income of about $7 per day. Her husband sells sugarcane juice, earning an income of $3.50 per day to help cover the family expenses.  

C. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase more lotus seeds for resale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to support her children’s studies. This is her fifth loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: Buy more lotus seeds for resale

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza Sambuunyam is 58 years old and lives with her husband in Arhangai province, Mongolia. She and her husband live together in a ger (the Mongolian nomadic tent). All of her children are grown up and live separately from them. 

Liza operates a dairy product trading business in her town. She has been successfully operating her business since 2004. Liza started her business with 90,000 MNT working capital, and after years of successful operation, today her working capital exceeds 800,000 MNT. Since she started her business, her family's standard of living has improved.  

She is an industrious person who has very good communication skills. She says, “My dream is one day to have my own plot of land with a house and yard.” Liza is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan to purchase more dairy products to resell to her customers.

loans.use: To purchase more diary products

loans.name: Good Sisters Group

texts.en:
Oneikeh F., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Good Sisters. She is 40 years old, married, and has four children who range from 9 to 20 years old. She was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to financial difficulties. All of her children are attending school.

For 5 years, she has been selling cooking oil on a table in the Congo Town Community, on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 10,000 Liberian dollars portion of this 38,000 Liberian dollars group loan to buy more cooking oil.

Her dream is to grow her business, make more profit, move from selling on a table to a shop, and continue to support her family.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Mrs. L., 53 years old, lives in the province of Kompong Tom, Cambodia, where she owns and farms a plot of land next to her house, raising pigs and crops to earn a living. She crops twice a year, and she was taught how to raise pigs and farm by her grandfather. She is a good mother and has four children. Two children are now married and live away from home, while the other two are single. Her husband works on the farm with her. L. doesn’t have enough supplies to use on the field during this coming rainfall season. So, L. has requested a loan to hire a laborer to plow the farmland and then to buy fertilizer and seed to grow. Note: Mrs. L. was busy at her business activity when the photo taken so her married son is pictured instead.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seed to grow.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es: Gregoria, de 52 años, es viuda y tiene tres hijos; Juan, Bertha y Wilder de 16, 13 y 11 años respectivamente. Juntos residen en la hermosa selva cusqueña, ubicada en la localidad de Quimbiri, donde tienen su propia casa. Todo inició cuando desde muy joven empezó a trabajar para un agricultor, en ese entonces cultivaba y cosechaba cacao, ella sentía que no tenia posibilidades de crecimiento y que solo con el sueldo que recibía procuraba ahorrarlo con la finalidad de tener su propio negocio. Actualmente cultiva y comercializa frutas, específicamente piña, y gracias a las enseñanzas de cultivo que le dieron sus padres, puede ahora obtener productos de alta calidad, por las cuales sus compradores más potenciales se sienten satisfechos, de esta manera este negocio le está dando buenos resultados económicos. Por lo general trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, en temporada de cosecha contrata personal para que le faciliten la extracción y traslado de sus productos hacia los centros de acopio de su comunidad, con la finalidad de poder venderlo a un precio justo. Sus planes a futuro es abrir su propia tienda con la finalidad de poder tener más ingresos. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus respectivos pagos, además agradece a su grupo comunal por la solidaridad que se dan entre cada uno de los compañeros. Con el crédito que solicita, lo piensa invertir para darle un adecuado cuidado a sus plantaciones, comprando insumos y abono, para prevenir las plagas u otras afecciones que atacan a las piñas.
texts.en:
Gregoria, age 52, is a widow. She has three children, Juan, Bertha, and Wilder, ages 16, 13, and 11, respectively. They live together in the beautiful jungle of Cusco province, located in the town of Quimbiri, where they have their own house.

When she was very young, she began working for a farmer who was then growing and harvesting cacao. She felt that she didn’t have any chance of progressing, and, only with the salary that she was receiving, she took pains to save money with the goal of having her own business.

Currently, she grows and sells fruit, specifically pineapples. Thanks to the education in farming given to her by her parents she now obtains high quality products with which potential purchasers are satisfied. Because of this the business is giving her good economic results.

In general, she works by herself, but occasionally she receives help from her children, and during the harvest season she hires people to assist her in picking and transferring her products to collection centers in her community with the goal of being able to sell them for a fair price. Her plan for the future is to open her own shop in order to be able to have greater income

This is her sixth loan with MFP, and she has promised to continue making all her payments. She is thankful to her communal group for the solidarity shown to each one of her colleagues. She plans to invest the loan she is applying for in giving adequate care to her crops by purchasing supplies and fertilizer in order to prevent disease and other infections that attack pineapples.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and supplies in order to care for her pineapple crop.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine J. is currently in the business of selling bedsheets, dresses and headdresses at the market and is requesting a loan to stock trousers and shoes to sell.

Josephine is 41 years old and is married to a head teacher. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

loans.use: To stock trousers and shoes to sell

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr: adjovi s'est lancée en 2008 dans les activités de restauration, elle fait spécialement de la cuisine togolaise. beaucoup de gens viennent manger chez elle parce qu'elle fait de bons plats. actuellement les condiments et autres produits nécessaires à la restauration sont épuisés, elle sollicite donc chez WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de  divers condiments et de produits nécessaires à l'activité de la restauration. elle est célibataire, c'est avec le revenu de son commerce elle subvient à ses propres charges.
texts.en:
Adjovi entered the restaurant industry in 2008 and specializes in Togolese cuisine. Her restaurant is well frequented because she makes great dishes. Currently condiments and other products that are essential for her cooking have run out, and so she is seeking a loan from WAGES so that she can stock up on these items. She is single and uses the revenue from this business in order to see to household demands.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase items necessary for her restaurant

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva T. is from the village of Salay, Angadanan, Isabela. She is 46 years old. Eva is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Eva owns and operates a transportation business. The main source of income is motorcycle transport. She also has a retail store in her village. Eva has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Eva joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Eva has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used as working capital to purchase additional inventory. Eva is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase materials needed to provide her services. This loan will be Eva's fifth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Because manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for its Field Partners to enable them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide services

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa T. is from the village of Andarayan South, Solana, Cagayan. She is 48 years old, married and has 2 adult-aged children. Marissa owns and operates a business selling  fish in the local community. Marissa has been engaged in her business for over 36 years and earns approximately 3.500 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Marissa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marissa has successfully repaid a previous loan  from ASKI. She is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Marissa from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Tumwesigye Women's Group-Mukono

texts.en:
39-year-old M. Firida belongs to Tumwesigye women’s group, Mukono. For the last 20 years she and her family have been counting on profits from fish sales in Mpunge for their subsistence.  Firida is happily married and she is happy to credit her husband with the inspiration to set forth in this business.

 Prior to taking root in this business she was involved in tailoring.  Her hard work and determination has gotten her this far, she says. All her five children are in school as a result of her hard work which sees her make Shillings 400,000 a  week. She also has a sideline dairy business that she says helps her supplement her profits. With this loan she wants to buy more fishing nets and also a dairy cow. This, she says, will go a long way toward helping her financially strengthen her business.

loans.use: The purchase of  more fishing nets and also a dairy cow

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia E. is a married woman who lives in Pandan, Brgy. Mahawak, Medellin, Cebu. She earns her living by fishing and selling ready-to-wear clothes. Her husband, Camelo E., age 42, works as a fisherman to earn his living. They have three children who are 11 to 17 years old. 

Patricia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, and by the sweat of her brow, Patricia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of 10,800 PHP, thus improving her family's standard of living. This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 15000, which she intends to use to purchase a pedicab so that she can continue to save up for the future of her children's education and her business. Patricia E. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem  that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase a transport vehicle and fishing equipment

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet K. lives in  Wandegeya Katanga neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school.  Juliet has a tailoring business.  She has been in this business for five years, and she works six days out of every week. Juliet sells her products from home, retail.    

Juliet has requested a loan of 300,000/= Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more rolls of cloth and thread. She also generates additional income through selling second-hand clothes.The main business challenges for Juliet include defaulters and the rainy season which hinders her customers from reaching out to her.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to build her own house and also to buy a cloth designing machine and an overlock sewing machine.    

Juliet lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of clothing materials and thread

loans.name: Edgar Percy

texts.es:
Edgar Percy tiene 72 años, es casado, tiene tres hijos, vive en la ciudad hermosa del Cusco, Perú y desde hace mucho tiempo que participa en el banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa. Edgar Percy es un trabajador jubilado pero sigue trabajando en su pequeño negocio de venta de sándwich y desempeña el cargo de administrador.
     
Edgar Percy con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de $ 400 USD, él invertirá el dinero para aumentar el capital del negocio y desea comprar insumos como por ejemplo panes, tomates, carne, pollo y muchas cosas más. 

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Edgar Percy, 72, has three children.  He lives in the beautiful city of Cusco, Perú.   He has collaborated with Arariwa’s Micro Finance Unit’s “Patrón de San Sebastián” communal bank for a long time.  Edgar Percy is a retired worker but he continues to work as Administrator of a small sandwich shop.

Edgar Percy expects to use his next, $400 USD, loan to buy ingredients like: bread, tomatoes, meat, chicken and many other things.

He is grateful for the opportunity provided through this means and pledges to repay in at timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy ingredients like bread, tomatoes, meat, chicken and many other things.

loans.name: Elizabeth Wanjiku

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman and the mother of five children. She lives in Oloitoktok, a peri-urban town along the Mombasa Nairobi highway. Elizbeth operates a phone accessories shop and wants to diversify and sell cereals such as maize, beans and peas as well. 

Elizabeth got to know about KADET through World Vision staff. She has never borrowed from other financial institutions. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to become a wholesale trader. She has applied for a loan to add more stock to her shop and buy cereals to diversify and expand.

loans.use: to buy phone accessories and cereals

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 38 year-old modest and single mother who lives in Ng’iya, which is about 90 kilometers west of the lakeside city of Kisumu. 

Janet operates a boutique in the Ng’iya shopping center where she sells clothing, footwear, and many other items to meet customer demand. She makes a monthly income of 30,000 KES from her business. She has requested her first loan of 10,000 KES to boost her business through the purchase of clothing and other items that are in demand by her customers. The festive holiday season is fast approaching, and Janet is optimistic that she will increase her profits due to the high demand for clothing during this season.

Being a single mother, Janet will use the profits from her loan to feed her family and buy more stock. Her hope is to see her business grow and expand.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a french fries selling business for over eight years, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. Jackline faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand and diversify her products in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000, she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes to make french fries for sale. She decided to join Yehu because it is a source for reliable funds and a customer focused organization.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of potatoes to make french fries for sale.

loans.name: Andrés Oswaldo

texts.es:
Andrés Oswaldo S. V. tiene 18 años de edad, Es Soltero vive con los padres en el Cantón de Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. No tiene hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNION SAN ANTONIO, Recinto San Antonio parroquia San José del Tambo distancia de la oficina a 150 minutos de la comunidad se encuentra dentro de los límites del Cantón Chillanes. Esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, cacao, naranja yuca. Esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Andrés Oswaldo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca. Compra sus productos en el Comercial  Matilde Esther y vende los  productos en Bucay.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, cacao, naranja yuca. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un terreno..

Le gusta disfrutar de las fiestas del pueblo.
texts.en:
Andrés Oswaldo S. V. is 18 years old.  He is single and lives with his parents in the canton of Chillanes, which is in Bolívar province.  He does not have any children.

The members of the "Union San Antonio" rural communal bank are based in the precinct of San Antonio, which is in San José del Tambo parish and Chillanes province.  Their community is located approximately 150 minutes from the office of Cooperativa San José.  The members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, cocoa, oranges, and cassava.  Collectively, they have many years of experience in this type of work.

Andrés Oswaldo plants corn, cocoa, oranges, and cassava.  He buys products in the Matilde Esther market and sells his produce in Bucay.

He is requesting this loan to purchase agricultural supplies and fertilizers for cultivating corn, cocoa, oranges, and cassava.  With the economic support provided by this loan, he will be able to better meet his needs.  He faces challenges like insect plagues and crop illnesses, as well as changes in the climate.  His dream is to buy his own plot of land.

He enjoys the local festivals in his village.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Andres Felipe

texts.es:
Andrés de 22 años,  es un joven emprendedor que le ha gustado innovar en el mercado de la agricultura y la crianza de animales para su venta. 

Viendo en una zona urbana ha trabajado para que su proyección de tener una pollera se haga realidad. Comenzó con pocos pollos dándoles balanceados por esa buena administración ahora esta vendiendo los pollos y trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 13h00 todos los dais. Vende cada pollo a $ 7.20. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones para su negocio por eso quiere continuar con su negocio trabajando con esfuerzo y dedicación pero para seguir necesita comprar con el préstamo pollos y balanceados con vitaminas para tener  un pollera saludable.
texts.en:
Andrés, 22 years old, is a young entrepreneur who has enjoyed being innovative in the field of agriculture and raising animals for sale.

Living in an urban area, he has worked so that his dream of having a chicken farm could be reality. He started with a few chickens, feeding them a balanced diet. Because of this good care he is now selling chickens, and he works from 7 am until 1 pm every day. He sells each chicken for $7.20.

He has many aspirations for his business, so he wants to continue working at his business with dedication, but to continue he needs to use this loan to buy chickens and feed with vitamins in order to have a healthy chicken farm.

loans.use: Chickens, feed

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en: Herminia T. is from the village of Barangay Roxas, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 46 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Herminia owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily use products to the local community. Herminia has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2011, Herminia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Herminia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Herminia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Karen Margarita

texts.es:
Karen P. O., de 28 años es la propietaria de la miscelánea y papelería. “Variedades Margarita”, ella vive con su cónyuge y su hijo de 10 años al sur de Barranquilla, en una comunidad muy productiva de gente trabajadora, solidaria y de un gran espíritu cívico,donde abundan microempresas en manos de mujeres. 
Karen inició su negocio hace un año, como una actividad para entretenerse, pero al ver los buenos resultados le imprimió mayor empeño, y así fue dándole forma hasta convertirla  hoy, en  otra fuente de ingreso para su hogar y una manera de sentirse útil y productiva. Su sueño es lograr ampliar su negocio con productos que tengan  precios módicos, donde pueda estandarizarlos simultaneamente  en un solo precio que llame la atención de sus clientes; camino a este propósito está aplicando a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo en la línea de Kiva, para comprar artículos de cacharrería, baldes plásticos, tasas, tanques, termos  y loncheras; inversión que proyecta ser exitosa por la gran capacidad de servicio de Karen y el potencial de clientes que tiene a su alrededor, de los cuales ya ha registrado encargos. Asi su asesor expresa que  sus indices financieros se encuentran en los siguientes rangos: liquidez 2 veces, rentabilidad sobre las ventas    entre 30 y 35%, endeudamiento actual 45%, rotación de inventarios de 15 a 20 dias y  que desde allí proyecta su crecimiento futuro.
texts.en: Karen is 28 years old and owns a general store and stationery shop called "Variedades Margarita." She lives with her husband and 10-year-old son to the south of Barranquilla in a very productive community of hard-working, united people full of civic pride, where there are many small businesses run by women. Karen started her business a year ago as a way to entertain herself, but after seeing the good results she started putting in more effort and was able to convert it into what it is today: another source of income for her household and a way to feel useful and productive. Her dream is to expand her business with affordable products that she can standardize with a singular price to attract her customers' attention. It's for this reason she is requesting her first loan from Kiva partner Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She plans to buy crockery items, plastic buckets, cups, bottles, thermoses and lunch boxes, an investment she predicts to be successful in increasing her service capacity and bring in potential customers from the area, including those she has already attracted. Her adviser says her financial indices are in the following ranges: two times liquidity, return on sales between 30 and 35 percent, current debt 45 percent, and inventory turnover 15 to 20 days, which projects for future growth.

loans.use: Purchase crockery items, plastic buckets, cups, bottles, thermoses and lunch boxes

loans.name: Maria Eusevia

texts.es:
Doña María, tiene 46 años de edad, reside en Ozatlan, departamento de Usulután, vive con su esposo y dos hijas de 23 y 14 años de edad, tiene un negocio el cual atiende hace 15 años, ubicado en el centro escolar de Ozatlan, el horario es de 6:00am a 6:00pm.
Ella ofrece en su negocio comida rápida, boquitas, bebidas, galletas, dulces, a los estudiantes y maestros del centro escolar, pero ahora necesita del apoyo de un préstamo para surtir el negocio de toda la mercadería antes mencionada.
Con la inversión espera dar abasto a la demanda generada por los estudiantes y mejorar las condiciones del hogar dándoles a sus hijos los estudios necesarios para que se superen.
texts.en:
María, 46 years of age, lives in Ozatlan, department of Usulután.  She lives with her husband and two daughters ages 23 and 14.  She has a business she’s been tending to for 15 years, located in the center of the school district in Ozatlan.  The business hours are 6:00 am to 6:00 pm.

She offers fast food, snacks, beverages, cookies and candies to the students and teachers of the school district.  However, she now needs the support of a loan in order to supply her business with all of the aforementioned merchandise.

With this investment, she hopes to meet the demand generated by the students.  Also, she would like to improve the conditions of the home, and give her children the necessary education to be successful.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a 59-year-old married woman living in the town of San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She is engaged in farming and has been planting and harvesting rice for more than 15 years.

Erlinda is in need of farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers. She requested a loan of 6000 PHP, which she will use to buy what she needs for her farm. Erlinda plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her farm.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Mbuzi Tukorrehamu Group

texts.en:
Richard is a 32-year-old married man living in his own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is solely charged with the responsibility of looking after his children, and his dream is to construct a permanent residential house.

He has been a carpenter for 10 years and he learned on the job with the help of his father. He has a challenge of customers who fail to pay on time, and his desire is to own a workshop. Richard needs the loan to buy timber for his carpentry work.

loans.use: to purchase timber

loans.name: Melina

texts.en:
Melina, age 41, owns and operates a sari-sari (general store) business. She has been running her store for 30 years and earns an additional income from food vending and e-loading businesses. She and her husband have three children.

Melina has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her store. She has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. Melina aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her store

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa L. es socia del banco comunal El Ahorro, vive por el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, cuenta con 4 ríos que la bañan y con varios lugares turísticos, su gente es muy amable y cordial.
 
La Señora. Rosa tiene 42 años, es divorciada y tiene 4 hijos de 23, 16, 14 y 4 años de edad, su primer hijo está comprometido y vive independiente, su segundo y tercer hijo  estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña Rosa es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, esta actividad la realiza hace un tiempo atrás, es vendedora ambulante y no tiene ni día ni horario fijo de trabajo. También se dedica  lavar ropa ajena de sus conocidas.

Es socia del banco comunal hace un año y medio. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa usada para tener más surtido en su mercadería.
 
Su sueño es tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Rosa L. is a member of the 'El Ahorro' community bank.  She lives in Cuenca city center.  This city is a World Heritage Site.  It is surrounded by four rivers and has several tourist sites.  The people are kind and friendly.

Rosa is 42 years old, divorced, and has four children aged 23, 16, 14 and 4.  Her eldest son is engaged and lives independently, her second and third children are attending high school in the city.  They don't own their own home but live in a rental house.

Rosa is a saleswoman who sells used clothing.  She has been in this business for some time.  She makes her sales as an itinerant street vendor and doesn't work regular days or hours.  She also washes clothes for people that she knows.

Rosa has been a member of her community bank for one and a half years.  She will invest her loan money in buying used clothing so that she can better stock her business.

Rosa's dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: to buy used clothing

loans.name: Pashalina

texts.en:
Pashalina is a 57-year-old lady, married to Patrick, and they do not have children. She has been selling second-hand clothes for 2 years, earning an income of 10,000 KES per month.

Pashalina learned about KADET LTD through a friend who is already registered with KADET LTD. This is her first loan, which she intends to use buy more second-hand clothes to sell.

In the future, she hopes to grow her business and be able to distribute clothes wholesale. Pashalina describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Paxboch Group

texts.es:
Doña Santos Margarita es casada, tiene 51 años D. edad, cursó los tres años D. educación básica, tiene 12 hijos 2 D. los cuales estan estudiando, se dedica a atender partos, y a la crianza D. animales en este caso la crianza D. gallina D. engorD., lleva ya 19 años con este oficio, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo quien se dedica a aserrar madera.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un prestamo, que lo utilizará para invertir para la compra D. pollos ya que tiene como objetivo principal tener una granja mas granD.; las demás integrantes se dedica a diversas actividades: crianza D. animales, venta D. tacos y servicio D. atención a partos. Esperan aumentar el tamaño D. la granja, para mejorar D. igual manera su condición D. vida.
texts.en:
Doña Santos Margarita is married. She is 51 years old. She had three years of basic education. She has 12 children, 2 of whom are in school. Her work is attending at births, and she also raises animals, in particular, she raises hens to fatten. She has been doing this for 19 years. She has help from her husband, whose work is sawing wood.

She is organizing a group to apply for a loan, which she will use to invest in the purchase of chickens, since her principal objective is to have a larger farm. The other members work in various activities: raising animals, selling tacos, and attending at births. She hopes to increase the size of her farm and in the same way to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Los Lirios Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LOS LIRIOS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Senkata, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Maribel. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: atención de pensión, venta de ropa, venta de detergentes, venta de figuras para chiflaría. 

La señora Maribel indica que es la primera vez que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de la promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de chiflaría (productos para realizar rituales culturales), el cual inicio al ver la capacidad de su esposo.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para comprar azúcar, para la elaboración de estos productos. Posterior a la elaboración este producto lo venderá en los comercios de la ceja (lugar comercial de la ciudad de El Alto). Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta salud.

En la foto encontramos a la prima de señora Maribel, que acompaño al grupo.
texts.en:
The association 'Los Lirios' (The Irises) will begin their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer in the Senkata Centre. The group is made up of eight members and is directed by an executive committee led by Maribel. The community group's members carry out a range of activities, including hotel reception and the sale of clothes, detergent and figurines used in cultural rituals. 

Maribel told us that this is the first time that she has worked with Pro Mujer after being invited to participate by their promoter. She currently runs a business selling products used in cultural rituals which she began after observing her husband's capabilities in the same field.

Maribel will use this loan to purchase sugar to make her products, after which she will sell them to the merchants of El Alto's commercial zone. This work allows her to generate an income to support her partner and their son.

When we asked Maribel what she liked about Pro Mujer, she told us that she liked health. 

In the photo we can see Maribel's cousin who took part in the group.

loans.use: to puchase sugar

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 43 years old. She is a self-motivated, hardworking mother of two, ages 21 and 23 years. She has been running a general shop for the past three years. Previously, she operated a cyber café. To supplement her earnings, she does small-scale farming. She wants 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy maize flour, sugar and rice.

In the next five years, she wants to be a well-established business lady in line with her dream to become a major goods distributor. Through Faulu Kenya, she has learned business management skills and how to make wise investments.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Víctor Pascual

texts.es:
Víctor Pascual  tiene 47 años, es casado vive con sus esposa e hijos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tienen 5  hijos José de 13 años, Jenesis de 10 años, Juan, Jeremías de 7 años y Isaac de 1 año.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. VALLE ALTO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Voluntad de Dios en el Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra maíz y arroz.


 Víctor se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol, Compra sus productos en el Comercial Peña y vende sus productos en el mercado mayorista de ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para mejorar su producción  y suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es llegar a ser ministro en la palabra de Dios. Enfrenta de la sequia.

Le gusta predicar la palabra de Dios.
texts.en:
Víctor Pascual is 47 years old, is married and lives with his wife and children in Ventanas Canton, de los Ríos Province.  He has 5 children, 13 year old José, 10 year old Jenesis, 7 year olds Juan and Jeremías and 1 year old Isaac.

The members of V.R.C. VALLE ALTO are located on the premises of Voluntad de Dios in Ventanas Canton.  The members of this communal bank make their living in agriculture, in short cycle farming, like corn and rice.

Víctor makes his living in agriculture.  He plants, corn, rice and beans.  He purchases his products in Peña's Stores and sells his products in the wholesale market in Ventanas.

Victor is requesting the loan to plant corn and rice and to purchase supplies and fertilizers for his crops.  The loan will help him financially to improve his production and to supplement his needs.  Victor's dream is to become a minister for the word of God.  He is facing drought.

Victor likes to preach the word of God.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Guram

texts.en:
Guram is from the village of Patara Lilo, East Georgia.  He is 33 years old, married and lives with his wife Tamar and mother Katia.  She is retired.

The main source of income for the family is agriculture, where all family members are involved.  In particular, they own 3 milk cows and produce yogurt. Produced yogurt is sold in Tbilisi by Katia and Guram.  Guram has 15 years experience in dairy farming. 

Guram requested a loan to purchase a plot of land which is located in his village.  He will use it for agriculture, for growing various fruits and vegetables and to sell it locally. 

Guram plans to use the increase in income to improve his family living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural land

loans.name: Houen

texts.en:
Houen is a housewife. Her husband is a construction worker with $3 per day for his income. She has three children, and all of them are working in the factory with an income of $3 per day each. Every month, she has to spend $80 on food, $10 on electricity and $20 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy construction material for re-building her house. This loan will help her to get a better house to live in with her family. In the future, she plans to buy more equipment for her husband's construction work so that he can make more income to support the family.

loans.use: To buy construction material for re-building her house.

loans.name: Reriman

texts.en:
Reriman is 45 years old. She lives in Kartal, a small district in İstanbul. She is married and has three children. The oldest one is 21 and the youngest one is 13 years old.

She has been working as a tailor in Kartal for 24 years. Also, she is selling fabric at her store. When she started her business years ago she had only two machines. During these years she has managed to increase them to three. She also has another store just for selling fabric.

With the help of the loan she will get from Maya, she is planning to increase the types of fabric in her store. She will both provide tailoring services and sell fabric to her customers.

She wants to develop her business to earn more money. She wants to help her children get a better education.

Reriman is a self-confident, hardworking, passionate woman.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Reriman 45 yaşında.İstanbul'un Kartal semtinde yaşıyor.Evli ve 3 çocuğu var.En büyüğü 21 ,en küçüğü 13 yaşında. 
Kartalda terzi dükkanı var, aynı zamanda dükkanda kumaş da satıyor.Reriman hanım 24 yıldır bu işi yapıyor.İşe başladığında 2 tane makinası varmış,zamanla bu makina sayısını üçe çıkarmış.Daha sonra sadece kumaşlarını sattığı bir dükkan daha açmış.Maya'dan aldığı kredi ile kumaş çeşidini arttıracak.Dikiş diktirmek isteyen kadınlara kumaş satıp aynı zamanda dikişini de yapacak.
Reriman Hanım işini daha da büyütüp,çocuklarına gelecekte iyi eğitim aldırmak istiyor.Reriman Hanım,kendine güvenen,çalışkan ve hırslı bir kadın.

loans.use: to buy more fabric

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. Alma has a shop that sells snacks like pan (bread), rice and cassava cakes. Her husband is providing motorela or habal-habal motorcycle-transportation services. She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan of 6,000 Philippines pesos to buy raw ingredients for making snacks. Alma has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Alma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Ndiande

texts.fr: Madame Ndiande est une célibataire de 28 ans qui évolue au Sénégal. Elle pratique  en même temps  la vente d’habits déjà confectionnés. Elle a une expérience de 3 ans dans cette activité qu’elle a choisie pour éviter de rester inactive. Ses moments les plus favorables sont les veilles de fête  ou elle parvient a confectionner beaucoup d’habits. Elle est sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis 2010. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour l’achat d’une machine a coudre. Son objectif est de démarrer la confection d’habits pour enfants  et accroitre ses bénéfices
texts.en:
Ndiande, age 28 is single and lives in Senegal. She sells ready-to-wear clothing. She chose this business to avoid staying inactive, and has three years of experience in this field. Her favorite moments are the days leading to a holiday, when she manages to make a lot of clothes.

She's been a member of UIMCEC since 2010, and she's seeking a loan of XOF 100'000, intended to buy a sewing machine. Her goal is to start making children's clothing and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Chhorn

texts.en: Chhorn, 49, resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Chhorn is a farmer and grows vegetables, earning an income of around USD 4 per day. Her husband buys fish to resell, earning an income of USD 5 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 40 on food and USD 30 on the other necessary expenses. Chhorn is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorbike to transport clay pots and other clay products to sell. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport clay pots and other clay products to sell

loans.name: Julan

texts.en:
Julan is 30 years old, married, and lives in the Philippines. Julan has a shop that sells fruits such as mangoes and apples. He has had this business for five years. He is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which he will use to buy fruits to sell.

Julan is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Julan hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase fruits to sell.

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru: Мархабо замужем и любящая мать двоих детей. Её муж работает мастером по ремонту техники. Она занимается купля продажей скота. Она откармливает скот и продает в выгодную цену, когда они набирают вес. Мархабо более 6 лет занимается этим бизнесом, и она изучала все слабые и сильные стороны данного бизнеса и набрала хороший опыт. Мархабо запрашивает займ для покупки скота и ремонт коровника. Она заранее благодарна вам за вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en: Marhabo is married and is a loving mother of two children.  Her husband works as an electronics master repairman.  Marhabo is involved in buying and selling livestock.  She fattens up livestock and sells it at a more profitable price, once it gains weight.  Marhabo has been in this business for over 6 years, learned all of the weaknesses and strengths of this business and gained a good experience.  Marhabo is requesting this loan for the purchase of livestock and repair of the cowshed.  She thanks you in advance for your help and mercy.

loans.use: to buy livestock and make repairs to the cowshed

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma is 43 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Wilma has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment. Wilma has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment

loans.name: Walter Antonio

texts.es:
Walter Antonio es comerciante debido a que vende discos compactos de música, video, cable para cd, limpiador de cd, entre otros vendiéndolos en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur.

Este negocio lo tiene establecido en el mercado municipal y además de este negocio tiene una caponera o triciclo para transportar personas, este triciclo lo trabaja día de por medio y le genera otros ingresos. Es importante señalar que Walter Antonio es casado y tiene dos hijos menor de edad, su esposa es ama de casa. 

El crédito lo solicita para la compra de discos compactos de música variada y navideña y videos para continuar comercializándolos en su establecimiento y así satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Walter Antonio is a merchant that sells music and video compact discs as well as cables and CD cleaners and other products in the town of San Rafael del Sur.  

He set up his business in the municipal market.  In addition to this business, he has a caponera or tricycle that he uses to transport people. He transports people by day to generate more income.  It is important to note that Walter Antonio is married and has two young children.  His wife attends to the household chores.  

He is requesting a loan to buy various music, Christmas, and video CDs to sell in order to satisfy his customer's demands.

loans.use: purchase music and video compact discs.

loans.name: Banco Comunal Cristo Nos Guia Group

texts.es: El banco Comunal Cristo Nos Guía está conformado por Claudia Ninosca, Norma Elena, Juana Francisca, Juana Esther, Pabla Isabel, Olga, Rosa, Maricela, Justina, Juana y Martha. Justina es una luchadora que cada día busca la manera de ampliar su local, ella se dedica a la venta de sopa. Desde hace más de 10 años que tiene este negocio, además Justina brinda el servicio de planchar y lavar pues como no obtiene suficientes ingresos tiene que salir todos los días por la tarde a ofrecer este servicio. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de verduras, carnes, limones, queso, cucharas entre otros.
texts.en: Cristo Nos Guía Communal Bank is made up by Claudia Ninosca, Norma Elena, Juana Francisca, Juana Esther, Pabla Isabel, Olga, Rosa, Maricela, Justina, Juana and Martha. Justina is a fighter, always trying to find ways to extend her premises. She works selling soup. She started her business over ten years ago. Justina also works doing laundry and ironing every evening because she does not generate enough income. With this loan, she will be able to buy vegetables, meats, lemons, cheese and spoons, among other things.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meats, lemons, cheese and spoons, among other things.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is married with two children. Betty is 36 years old and lives in La Union, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Betty owns a retail store to earn a living and has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns 5000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 3000 to purchase spices for her retail business.

Betty has been a member of PMPC for more than one year. In the future, Betty hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spices for her retail business.

location.town: Liloy-La Union, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Daphine

texts.en: Daphine is 30 years old and lives with her child in the town of Kasese, Uganda. Her goal is to earn enough money to educate her child, and she has supported her family by running a beauty salon for the last five years. Daphne has done very well despite having to deal with problems such as inflation and frequent changes in price. She is applying for this loan to buy supplies for her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a beauty salon.

loans.name: Yanit

texts.es: El señora Yanit tiene como actividad  la confección de deportivos,  que realiza juntamente con su esposo durante  dos años, tiene un hijo de menor de cinco años, su esposo esta trabajando en una empresa textil  en turno de la mañana, el momento de la visita se encontraban confeccionando en su domicilio ubicado en la zona villa ingenio del Alto ,  su venta  es quincenalmente en la localidad de desaguadero frontera con Perú, esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para ellos, en esta ocasión solicitan financiamiento para la compra de una maquina industrial de doble aguja para cubrir su demanda que tiene, así para tener un mejor ingreso para vivir mejor.
texts.en: Yanit has been making sports clothing along with her husband for two years.  They have a 5-year old son.  Her husband works in a textile business on the morning shift.  When we visited, we found them sewing in their house which is located in Villa Ingenio del Alto area.  They sell every two weeks in a town located in Desaguadero on the border of Peru.  This business is their main source of income and they are requesting financing to buy a double-needle industrial sewing machine so they can cover their orders.  That way they will have a higher income to live better.

loans.use: to buy a double-needle sewing machine

loans.name: Ortikoi

texts.ru: Ортикой пожилая женщина 64 лет. Она замужем имеет 8 детей. Муж раньше работал на заводе, теперь он пенсионер разводит дома скот. Сыновья и дочери находятся в России. Её дети помогают материально присылая деньги с России. Она разводит скот в течении 20 лет.  Ей по хозяйству помогают внуки. Сотрудничает с нашей организации около 2 лет. Кредит получает на покупку коз и овец.
texts.en: Ortikoi is an elderly, 64 year-old woman.  She is married and has eight children.  Her husband previously worked at a plant and is now a retiree, who breeds livestock at home.  Their sons and daughters are in Russia.  Ortikoi's children help her financially by sending money from Russia.  She has been breeding livestock for 20 years.  Her grandchildren help her with the household.  Ortikoi has been partnering with our organization for about two years.  She is requesting this loan to purchase goats and sheep.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and goats

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is a 39-year-old, married man.  He has three children between the ages of 12 and 19 years old. He describes himself as honest.  Juma operates a retail store where he sells coconuts. He has been involved in this business for two years.  His business is located viable area and his primary customers are both return customers and new ones. He says his biggest business challenge is inadequate funds. 

Juma will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more coconuts to sell.  His business goal is to run a coconut industry within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts to sell from his retail shop.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy sells perfumes and cosmetics door-to-door in her neighborhood. Because Mercy was raised in a very poor household, she was forced to be a saleswoman from a very young age. She has been selling cosmetics and perfume for about 11 years. Thanks to her business she has been able to provide an important source of income for her household, especially at times when her husband was out of work.

She needs this loan in order to invest in products. Because Christmas is coming soon she will have a significant increase in demand. She wants to take advantage of this situation for the holiday season.

Mercy and her two children live with her husband at his parent’s home. He worked for a large company for 8 years until he was fired a year ago. He just found a new job as a salesman, but he is not sure if it will last long. Mercy’s goal is to set up a sector of her in-laws home as a point of sale for her business. She plans to continue to invest in merchandise before making any changes in construction.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in products prior to the holiday season

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria T.’s business is making clothes for both ladies and men. Maria’s sewing machine was funded by her first loan of $750, and she is now on her second loan of $1250. Maria works four days a week and she sews a puletasi (traditional wear) for $20, and charges $40 when she designs the garment too. She has one son who is a good business man. She is requesting a loan to purchase more sewing materials that will increase the variety of designs she can offer.

loans.use: To purchase rolls of materials, threads, needles, paint, glitter

loans.name: Yesenia Matilde

texts.en:
Yesenia is 21 years old and single. When she was 15 she had to immigrate to the city in search of a better way of life and to continue her studies. Right now she is in her sixth semester of pre-university school. She also sells cosmetics, creams, and perfumes. For much of her life she has struggled to support her studies and her aspirations of being a successful professional. Her parents have been unable to provide the necessary funds to support her because they are field workers and live in their native community. Yesenia is a part of the Laguna Azul 2 Group.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

YESENIA TIENE 21 AÑOS, SOLTERA, CUANDO TENIA 15 AÑOS TUVO QUE EMIGRAR A LA CIUDAD EN BUSCA DE MEJORES CONDICIONES DE VIDA Y SEGUIR CONTINUANDO CON SUS ESTUDIOS, ACTUALMENTE CURSA EL SEXTO SEMESTRE DE LA PREPARATORIA. ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE COSMETICOS, CREMAS Y PERFUMES. HA LUCHADO A LO LARGO DE SU VIDA PARA SOSTENER SUS ESTUDIOS Y LOGRAR SER UNA GRAN PROFESIONISTA, YA QUE SUS PADRES NO HAN PODIDO APOYARLA DEBIDO A QUE NO CUENTAN CON EL DINERO QUE ELLA NECESITA, ELLOS SON CAMPESINOS Y VIVEN EN SU COMUNIDAD NATAL. YESENIA ES PARTE DEL GRUPO LAGUNA AZUL 2.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics, creams, and perfumes

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es:
Teodoro lives in his own home in the Llojeta zone in the city of La Paz with his wife, Angelica Condori and their 7 and 10 year-old children. Teodoro is employed as a janitor by the municipal government of the city of La Paz and his wife works selling fish from a street cart. With their past loans they were able to build two rooms and a bathroom on their home that they are able to use, but those rooms do not offer them the comfort or convenience that they need. This loan would be dedicated to the construction of two new rooms that would improve the living conditions of their family. Their past experiences with Impro have proved them to be preferential clients and prove their ability to access new credit.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

Teodoro vive en casa propia en la zona de Llojeta de la Ciudad de la Paz con su esposa, Angélica Condori y sus hijos de 7 y 10 años; Teodoro es empleado barrendero en la empresa municipal de aseo de la Alcaldía de la ciudad de La Paz y su esposa vende pescado en un puesto de venta ambulante. Con créditos anteriores en Impro construyeron dos habitaciones y un baño que actualmente ocupan, pero que no les brinda la comodidad necesaria, por ello el préstamo solicitado será destinado a la construcción de dos habitaciones nuevas que mejoraran las condiciones de hábitat de la familia. Su antecedente histórico con Impro, la califica como cliente preferencial y puede acceder un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Construction on his home

loans.name: Amid

texts.en: Amid  is 23 years old, single and lives in the Khaladj village of the Salyan region. He has his own farming business. Now he requests a loan of $1200 to buy fertilizer and pesticides. He has 2 years of experience in this business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro, 28, lives with his partner of eleven years, Beatriz, and their three lovely children aged 11, 6 and 4. They live in the city of Itá where their children attend primary school.

Pedro is a tailor who specialises in making suits. He learned how to tailor when he was very young. He decided to take on this business in order to provide his family with an additional source of income. He worked for many years as an employee in other tailoring shops. After four years, he was able to move on and become independent. Today he runs his own store, a small tailoring shop with his partner Beatriz. They work together to make the suits, which they sell in their store. Although the two initially faced many difficulties in sustaining their business, they are doing well today.They make suits exclusively for a well-known store called L’UOMO, which has a branch in the capital.

Pedro’s dream is to continue expanding his store and is thus requesting a loan to invest in construction and put him on the road to realising his dream.

loans.use: To invest in construction (expanding his store)

loans.name: Marta Abad

texts.en:
Marta is twenty-four years old, and she and her husband have three children who all attend school. Her husband works in the city council.

Marta has recently begun selling paintings with loans she obtained from our organization. She has to travel outside her community to get the paintings or pictures on the wholesale market and then she retails them in the public square.

Marta envisions her business becoming a big shop with a large range of paintings to offer her customers. With her loan, she will buy more goods, especially drawings closely related to Christmas, to sell during the holidays.

loans.use: To buy paintings to supply a small store

loans.name: Emanuela

texts.en:
Hello from Mbeya, Tanzania! Emanuela M. is 35 years old and she is married with three children, ages 5, 10, and 14. In 1999 Emanuela established a snack business. She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requests a loan of $200 to purchase the ingredients needed to make mandazi (triangular spiced donuts), chapatis, and chai (tea). She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback".

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her snack business in bulk

loans.name: Chawkat

texts.en: Chawkat is a 34 year old father of one. He works and lives with his wife and child in south Lebanon, in Saida. Chawkat owns a children's clothing store. He needs a loan to buy new merchandise to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: To buy new merchandise for his clothing sales business

loans.name: Zabibu's Heri. Group

texts.en:
Zabibu is 30 years old and is a single woman. Zabibu owns a small grocery store that she started in 2004. Everyday, she works from 6:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

In the past, Zabibu has taken out a successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in food vending.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice A.'s fashion home has a special outlook as clothes are well arranged in different colors. Eunice is married with four children.  As a fashion designer she sews in different kinds of styles. She equally sews male and female clothes. This is a business she learned for 3 years. At 39 years of age Eunice is determined to improve her business . She has been in her business since 1998. She needs a loan 0f $450 to enable her to buy more cloth and tailoring materials for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and tailoring materials.

loans.name: Sejada

texts.en: Sejada was born in 1983 and she is married. She lives with her husband and 4 children near the town of Visoko. Her husband buys and resells copper, aluminum and scrap iron from the scrap-heap. He can earn about 1 500 KM (US$ 1200). Sejada will use this loan in the amount of US$ 975 to buy more of this material for reselling in order to earn more money.  Her wish is to earn money in order to finish her house that she started to build.

loans.use: To buy scrap metal for re-sale

loans.name: Limota

texts.en:
Limota S. sells foodstuffs including garri (a granular, starchy food made from cassava) and elubo (fermented yam flour) in Okoko, Lagos State, Nigeria. She acquired the skill over a 5-year period and she has been in the business since the year 1978. She is 52 years old and married with 4 children.

Limota is requesting a loan of $775 to buy more foodstuffs for sale. She believes that this will increase her profit. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale.

loans.name: Yao

texts.fr:
Yao A. is 29 years old, married, with two children. He has a café in Assahoun, a village located about 50 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this second loan from FECECAV (Kiva Field Partner), he wants to fix up his café to attract a much larger clientele and also open a new café for his younger brother. By doing this he is contributing to the improvement in living standards of his family and also his community.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

Yao A. est âgé de 29 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Il tient une cafétéria à Assahoun, un village situé à environ 50 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il souhaite par ce second crédit de FECECAV aménager sa cafétéria pour attirer beaucoup plus de clientèle et aussi ouvrir une nouvelle cafétéria pour son petit frère. Ce faisant il contribue à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de a famille et aussi de sa communauté.

loans.use: To fix up his café to attract a much larger clientele and also open a new café for his younger brother

loans.name: Oysifat

texts.ru:
Oysifat S. lives in the city of Vahdat. She is 25, married with two children. She has finished high school. Oisifat buys and then sells children's clothing and shoes. She has a small selling spot at the market. Oysifat has been in this business for over four years. Currently, the client would like to increase the variety and amount of goods by purchasing fall shoes and clothes. She needs money to do this. This is why she decided to ask for a loan for 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Сафарова Ойсифат Эшонкуловна жительница города Вахдат. Возраст 25 лет, замужем, имеет 2 детей.Образование среднее. Ойсифат занимается куплей продажей детской оджеды и обувью .На рынке города она имеет небольшую торговую точку. Имеет опыт в этой деятельности более 4 лет. В данный момент клиентка хочет увеличить ассортимент торговой точки, закупить сезонную обувь и одежду. Для чего ей нужны денежные средства.Поэтому она решила взять кредит сроком на 6 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase variety and amount of goods

loans.name: Ekatte

texts.en: Ekatte has a vegetable farm where she plants many items including pumpkins, waterleafs e.t.c. She has been operating this business for the past five years. She apprenticed with a farmer for over a year. Ekatte works at the farm from 5am-7pm. When her children are on holidays they help her with the farm work. Market women come to her farm to buy vegetables to resell at wholesale and retail. Ekatte is married to Mr. F. and they have four children. She is requesting a loan amount of $450 to buy more vegetable seedlings for planting.

loans.use: Purchase more seedlings for planting

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en: Rahila (whose husband is pictured in the photograph) is 54 years old and has 4 children. She lives in the Mashtaga settlement of Baku. For the past 20 years, Rahila has been running her own farming business. At present, her family needs a loan of US$1,200 to buy seeds and fertilizers for improving the business.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La Señora Gloria tiene un negocio de estética al cual le está haciendo falta un espacio para la sala de espera y así sus clientes estén más cómodos mientras los atiende. Este negocio y el trabajo de su esposo el señor Sergio es la fuente de ingreso de su familia ya que tiene tres hijos que están todavía estudiando.

.

La Señora Gloria y el señor Sergio están solicitando un préstamo de $1,000.00 para comprar el material y poder construir la sala de espera para ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gloria has an aesthetics business which is missing the space for a waiting room and so her clients could be more comfortable while she attends to them. This business and her husband Sergio's job is the means of income for the family now that she has three children who are still studying.

Mrs. Gloria and Sergio are asking for a loan of $1000 to buy the material and be able to build the waiting room to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a waiting room

loans.name: Yon

texts.en: Mrs. Yon R. is 44 years old and makes a living selling groceries and raising pigs at home. She is the mother of three children, all in school, and they live in Kompong Tom Province. Her husband, Mr. Khon Sim, 43, is a rice farmer and he has musical instruments for rent for wedding parties and other ceremonies. He currently earns $5 a day. Yon requested a loan of 4,000,000 riel ($1000) to decorate her house and the rest to pay a house builder.

loans.use: To decorate house

loans.name: Ek

texts.en: Mr. Ek S., 54, and his wife, Saov Yoan, 39, are residents of Pursat Province. The couple have four children, all of whom are still young and attending school. They are farmers who own a plot of land in their village to grow different kinds of crops like rice, fruits and vegetables.  They have been in this business since 1979. These crops are the main source of income for their family.To alleviate the hard physical labour and to expand the business, Mr. S. would like to apply for a loan to purchase a farming machine for plowing and transportation purposes.

loans.use: To purchase a farming machine

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Luis Fernando S. le está haciendo falta un cuarto mas para sus hijas  ya que son jovencitas y necesitan su propio espacio y el desea lo mejor para ellas. Pero por el momento no cuanta con el capital necesario para realizar la mejora, es por eso que solicita este préstamo y así sus niñas ya tenga su propia recamara.
Don Luis Fernando tiene un pequeño taller de herrería  desde hace más de cuatro años, el cual es el ingreso de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Luis Fernando S.’s home is missing a room for his daughters. As they are now young ladies they need their own space and he wishes the best for his daughters. But at the moment he doesn’t have the necessary capital to make this improvement, so he is soliciting this loan so that his daughters can have their own bedroom. Luis Fernando has had a small blacksmith shop for more than four years, and this is his family’s source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a bedroom for his daughters

loans.name: Ablavi
