texts.fr: Madame MLAGANI ablavi habite le quartrier d’agoè à lomé, elle a pour activtés génératrices de revenus la vente de chaussures et de produits génériques, elle a commencé à faire ce travail au debut de l’année 2008, elle est mariée et  a eu deux (02) enfants avec son mari qui est employé à la lonato. Avec ce qu’elle gagne de plus de ce commerce, elle arrive à aider son mari dans les dépenses du foyer. Etant en besoin de réapprovisionnement, elle sollicite de chez wages un crédit d’un montant de 150000F CFA
texts.en:
Ms. Ablavi MLAGANI lives in the Agoè district in Lomé. She works to earn an income selling shoes and generic pharmaceutical products. This is work that she began in the beginning of 2008. She is married and has two children with her husband, who is employed at LONATO (the national lottery of Togo). With what she earns in addition to her commerce, she manages to assist her husband in covering household expenses. Being in need of supplies, she is requesting from WAGES a loan in the amount of 150,000 francs CFA.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes and generic pharmceuticals for resale

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica O. is 26 years old and married with two children. She sells provisions and foodstuffs. She lives in Agbor, Delta state, Nigeria. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN ($350) to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Jesus Es Mi Pastor Group

texts.es:
Es un Banco D. Emprendimiento compuesto D. 18 personas, el cual pertenece a la Localidad del Km.:13 Urbanización arco iris la mayoría D. los clientes se dedican a la venta D. chancho, frutas, servicio D. peluquería, chofer y venta D. comidas, ropa, pan, otros.
Lidia Irene C. Mamami.- es la líder del banco, vive en el Km.13 en la urbanización arco iris, cuenta con casa propia, su actividad es venta D. comida, su esposo se desempeña como chofer en la Ciudad D. Santa Cruz.
Hernán L. H..- es el tesorero del banco D. emprendimiento, se desempeña como chofer en la línea D. micros No 35, D. la Ciudad D. Santa Cruz, su esposa se dedica a la venta D. pan, en la urbanización arco iris, tienen 2 hijos, viven en vivienda alquilada. Su deseo es llegar a obtener su propia herramienta D. trabajo, tener una vejez digna.
Ingrid V. A..- Vive en la urbanización arco iris, se dedica a la peluquería, su esposo se desempeña chofer en la ciudad D. Santa Cruz, con el cual tiene 2 hijos, vive en casa propia, en el banco D. emprendiendo se desempeña como secretaria, su deseo es llegar a tener un centro D. belleza en la urbanización arco iris, para poder ayudar a su esposo en la educación superior D. sus hijos.
texts.en:
This village bank is maD. up of 18 members of the Km. 13 Arco Iris Neighborhood. The majority of the members sell pork, fruit, proviD. hair or taxi service, sell food, clothing, bread and more. Lidia Irene C. Mamami is the leader of the bank, lives in the Km. 13 Arco Iris Neighborhood, has her own home, and she sells food. Her husband works as a driver in Santa Cruz city. Hernán L. H. is treasurer of the bank and works as a micro bus driver on line #35 in Santa Cruz city. His wife sells bread in the Arco Iris Neighborhood. They have 2 children and live in a rented home. His wish is to obtain his own tool business and have a dignified old age. Ingrid V. A. lives in the Km. 13 Arco Iris Neighborhood and is a hair stylist. Her husband works as a driver in Santa Cruz city. They have 2 children, live in their own home, and she is the bank’s secretary. Her wish is to have a beauty store in the lives in the Arco Iris Neighborhood in order to be able to help her husband with the higher education of their children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy needed items for their respective businesses

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice E. sells beer and local brew and is requesting a loan to open up a bar. Alice is 27 years old, married, and has no children. Her husband is a peasant. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a bus for her business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open a bar

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es: Blanca Estela M. D. C. vive junto a su hija la cual trabaja como maestra y estudia al mismo tiempo en la universidad, también vive junto a su nieta y su hermano el cual trabaja como sastre. Ella posee una pupusería desD. hace 30 años, debe trabajar muy duro ya que es viuda y no recibe ayuda D. nadie, es por ello que cada día se esfuerza por obtener lo necesario para vivir dignamente. Blanca Solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar la materia prima para la elaboración D. pupusas (platillo típico salvadoreño el cual esta hecho a base D. masa D. maíz o arroz, la cual se mezcla con chicharro, queso y frijoles y se le da la forma D. una tortilla). Debido a que esta es su única vía para obtener el dinero necesario para sus gastos, ella desea poder mejorar su negocio y ser la número uno en su colonia y que las personas la prefieran por la calidad D. su servicio, D. manera que sus ventas aumenten.
texts.en:
Blanca Estela M. D. C. lives with her daughter, who works as a teacher while also studying at university. They also live with Blanca's granddaughter and brother, who works as a tailor. For 30 years, Blanca has run a shop that sells pupusas which are corn tortillas stuffed with cheese, beans, and pork, then grilled. She has had to work very hard, especially since she is a widow and cannot rely upon anyone else for support, so every day she strives to make enough to live with dignity. Blanca is asking for a loan so that she can buy the ingredients for her pupusas. It is the only way for her to get enough money to cover her costs. She hopes to increase her sales and improve her business, making it the best in the neighbourhood. She hopes that people will recognize the quality of her service.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients

location.town: San Rafael Cedros, departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice A. currently sells plates and cups in her shop and is requesting a loan to stock more goods to sell. She is a forty-two year old woman whose husband works with OXFAM in Southern Sudan as an assistant administrator.  They have four children, three girls and one boy, all of whom attend the primary level school. With the extra profits from her loan, Alice hopes to be able to build a bar for selling beer and other drinks.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more goods in her shop.

loans.name: Lilian Marina

texts.es: Lilian Marina R. R. vive en el municipio de Tonacatepeque ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Lilian esta acompañada y tiene dos hijos Henry de 16 años de edad y Raquel de 13 años de edad ambos asisten a la escuela. Lilian cuenta con el respaldo económico de su esposo ya que él es taxista pero los ingresos no son suficiente para los gastos que sostiene mes a mes la familia, es por ello que Lilian sale de su casa a su negocio ubicado en un puesto en Tonacateque , Lilian vende variedad en cosméticos , fruta y refrescos . Ella solicita un crédito por que quiere comprar la suficiente mercadería para ofertar a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lilian Marina R. R. lives in the municipality of Tonacatepeque located in the department of San Salvador. Lilian is in a relationship and lives with her two children, Henry, age 16 and Raquel, age 13. Both of whom are in school. Lillian receives financial support from her husband who works as a taxi driver but his income is not enough to cover the expenses of the family for the whole month. This is the reason why Lilian has her own business located in Tonacateque. Lilian sells a variety of cosmetics, fruits and sodas. She is requesting a loan because she wants to buy enough merchandise to offer her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Yvette Diaz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda P. is from the village of Sta. Felomina, Iligan City. She is 60 years old. Gilda is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Gilda owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from curtain making and upholstery service in their village. Gilda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gilda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gilda is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide her upholstering service. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Gilda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide her upholstery service

location.town: Santa Felomena, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Martha Isabel

texts.es: La Señora Marta Isabel Martínez S. tiene la edad de 53 años. Es madre soltera. Su actividad económica es venta de comida. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que anteriormente era su Mama quien se hacía cargo de esta actividad, por lo que ella ayudaba en la elaboración de la comida. Y así fue como fue instruyéndose en esta actividad. Ya que algunas veces ella salía a vender a las calles para obtener más ganancia. Por lo que Martha tenía problemas pues ella no logro terminar sus estudios. Pero con este negocio obtuvo lo necesario para vivir. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de arroz, frijoles, aceite, pollo y verduras. El deseo de Martha es poseer su propio local para prestar mejores servicios al consumidor.
texts.en:
Mrs. Martha Isabel Martínez S. is a 53 year old single mother. She has been selling food for 4 years. Her mother had been in the same line of business, so she helped with the food preparation while learning about the business at the same time. She occasionally sold her products in the streets in order to earn more money.

Due to some setbacks, Martha was not able to complete her studies. However, her business was enough for her to make a living. Her loan will be used as working capital to buy rice, beans, oil, chicken and vegetables. Martha hopes to have her own restaurant where she can better serve her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch T. is 36-years old. He lives in Takeo province with his wife who sells roast beef. He has three school-aged children.  To make a living, Touch has a middle-man business selling motorbikes and he has been in this business for over six years. Touch earns approximately 20,000 riel or about US $5 a day.  His wife makes about US $3 per day to help support the family.

Touch joined CREDIT MIF to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and improve his ability to engage in business activities. Touch is requesting his first loan from CREDIT of US $1000. This loan will be used to invest in expanding the business. (Touch is pictured with his wife at home)

loans.use: To purchase motorbikes

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
La señora Mery es socia del Banco Comunal “6 de Enero”, en el distrito de de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 25 años de edad, estado civil soltera y sin hijos, tiene estudios de de educación segundaria completa, vive en el Barrio san Miguel.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 3 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto con lo cual pudo adquirir fibra de alpaca.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, el préstamo le servirá para poder comprar fibra de alpaca  y los vende en Juliaca, Arequipa y Lima, también se dedica a la venta de quesos en el mercado de Ilave.

Uno de sus mas grandes sueños es formar una gran empresa de venta de fibra al por mayor y proveer a las fabricas textiles.

A ella le gustan las reuniones ya que en ella se comparten diferentes vivencias y también las charlas de capacitación
texts.en:
Ms Mery is a member of “February 6th” Community Bank located in the Llave district, in the province of El Callao, in the department of Puno. She is 25 years old, single and doesn’t have children. She has completed her secondary school education. She lives in the community of San Miguel. She has worked for the Manuela Ramos Movement for three years. Her first loan was for 300 soles. She used this money to buy alpaca yarn. Currently she is asking for a loan of 1,000 new soles. This loan will be used to buy alpaca yarn that is sold in Juliaca, Arequipa and Lima. Mery also sells cheese in the market in Llave. One of the largest dreams that Mery has is to start a large business where she sells yarn at a wholesale level. This fiber would be sold to textile factories. Mery likes meetings where people share different experiences. She also enjoys training presentations.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase alpaca yarn

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
54-year old Nelly Fajagutama owns and manages a small basic store. She has five children, the eldest of whom is 32 years old, and her children are her inspiration to perform better in her retailing ventures. She started her business in 1992. The business grew well, and now she has plenty to display. 

She hopes to open a grocery store next year , where she could hire workers, display more goods and earn a larger income.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizers. Receiving this loan will help her enough to grow her business and attract more customers.

She likes CEVI services a lot. She says that "In CEVI, people are taught to do business and savings, and are provided with financial assistance in the form of credit or loan."

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia B.'s main source of income comes from operating a tricycle transport service. She is 46 years old, widowed and has two adult children. She is from the town of Segatic Daku Clarin Misamis Occidental. Cecilia has been in this business for over 11 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Cecilia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Cecilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. Cecilia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to repair her vehicle to provide better service. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 37 year old businessman. He has been running a glass sales business in Gikomba Market Nairobi for three years. He is requesting for a first loan of Kes. 10,000 in order to add stock of glass. A father of three, David hopes to own a glass shop. He describes himself as hardworking.



About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock

loans.name: Leonides

texts.es:
Leonides es una mujer de 52 años, tiene 3 hijos, pero sólo vive con la última en su casa propia. Los trabajos agrícolas los realiza en compañía de su pareja, siembra arvejas, papas y lechugas. En el caso de la hortaliza prefiere cultivarla a medias porque le parece muy trabajoso y se requiera de muchas paciencia; por ello ella le da el terreno y semillas a otra persona (su socio) y él es el encargado de hacerla producir. 
Mientras eso, Leonides está avocada al cultivo de sus papas y arvejas, y luego de tres meses aproximadamente, cuando sus lechugas están listas, junto a su socio, realizan la cosecha, que posteriormente envía a uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Lima y si es época de verano, sus ganancias son mayores.

Leonides está muy feliz de contar con un socio honesto y que le retribuye logrando que su producción aumente.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, ella fue quien organizó a todos sus compañeros para formar su propio banco comunal, donde aparte de obtener un crédito cuentan con un seguro de vida y esto es uno de los aspectos que más le gusta a Leonides. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de semillas para su próxima siembra de lechugas.
texts.en:
Leonides is a 52-year-old woman. She has 3 children, but only lives with the youngest, in her own home. Together with her partner, she cultivates peas, potatoes and lettuces. In the case of the lettuces, she prefers to only tend them half-way because she feels they are very labor intensive and require a lot of patience. For that reason, she passes on the land and the seed to another person (her partner) and he is then in charge of making it productive. Meanwhile, Leonidas focuses on the potatoes and peas. In about three months, when the lettuces are ready, together with her partner, they harvest their products which are then sent to one of the markets in Lima. If it's Summer season, their profits are larger. Leonides is very happy to count on an honest partner who repays her by producing a larger yield. This is her first loan with MFP. It was she who organized all her associates to form their own communal bank where, besides being able to secure loans, they also have life insurance and this is one of the features that Leonidas likes best of all. The funds she is seeking now will be used to buy seed for her next lettuce planting.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seed.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth creates sweaters and skirt suits in her business, "Ndinda Knitting". She is 38 years old and married with three children, ranging in age between 4 and 14. She started this business one year after being retrenched from Kenya Railways. She employs four people. She is requesting a loan for 70,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase a hand flat knitting machine and knitting yarn.

This is Ruth’s second loan and she says her first loan of 30,000 KES helped her business a lot. Her hope for the future is to have a big business that creates employment for others and to be able to leave an inheritance for her children.

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a deposit-taking micro-finance company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To purchase a knitting machine and yarn

loans.name: Phea

texts.en: Mrs. Phea N. lives in Thorm Nei village in Takeo Province where she owns a plot of land upon which she cultivates rice. She also sells water lilies in the local market to earn more income for her family. Now she is applying for a loan to buy a buffalo for breeding. Mrs. Phea N. is a 52-year-old widow with four children, one of whom is employed in a Casino Club while another is a laborer and the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for breeding.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is a 34-year-old married woman with three children between 4 and 13 years old. All her children go to school. She rents a two-room house where she is staying with five people. She takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but no piped water and gets three meals a day.  She incurs transport costs to and from buying Bitengi (African attire) from Arua, one of the many districts of northern Uganda and uses public transport to and from shopping. She works in a semi-urban area, which is on the outskirts of Kampala. Betty works six days a week. She receives an average of four customers a day and sells to all categories of people. She moves door-to-door selling African attire. Her major business challenges are highway thieves and the rainy season, which hinders her movements.  Betty has been in this business for four years and with MCDT for seven years, servicing her 14th loan. She wants to use this loan to buy more African attire. She hopes to see her business grow bigger and to own a permanent business premise.

loans.use: To buy more African attire to sell

loans.name: C2691 Amizero Group

texts.en:
Chantal is the group representative of a group composed of four people who have different kinds of business.
 
Chantal is 28 years old and is married with two children who are twins, seven years old. She also takes care of three dependents from her family, aged between 8 and 12. This big family lives in the Eastern Province of Rwanda, approximately two hours drive from Kigali, the capital city.

Chantal is a self-employed businesswoman selling foodstuffs such as rice, beans, flour, etc. She has been in this business for seven years and works from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. every day except Sunday.

Chantal is requesting her first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to reinvest in her business. She will use the loan to purchase more quantities of foodstuffs which will allow her to attract more customers.

If this strategy is successful Chantal will be able to earn more profits which will help her to achieve her family goals to save money for her future and pay school fees for her children and her dependents.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: The grocery business has been very good. Vivian, who is from Delta state, has been in this business for the past ten years. She is 32 years old and married with two children. She hopes for a loan of 100,000 NGN. She will use this loan to invest in her business, buying in bulk to get a better price. She hopes that this loan will help her build a business that will be profitable and provide benefits for her children. She says thanks to Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Lach

texts.en: Lach K., 45, owns a handicraft enterprise producing rattan cupboards. She is one of the low-income people living in Kompong Tom province. She saves many sets of her items before sending them out with her husband to sell door-to-door around the community. Lach K. has been very busy at her business with many clients who need her products. Recently Lach K.'s products are in demand by her clients but she doesn’t have enough items to serve them. That is why she applied for a loan to purchase more rattans.

loans.use: To purchase more rattans

loans.name: Kiều's Group

texts.en:
N. Kiều Thị B. (20206020031) is a 23-year-old woman living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. N. is the group leader for a seven-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Đồng Nhân 1 - Nhóm 05 (Nhóm 05).

N. is married and has one infant child. To making a living, N. owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of food products in the local community. N. has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, N. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. N. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,256,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,496,000 VND which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her third loan from SEDA. N. plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. Trần Thị C. (20206020032) is a 25-year-old woman who is requesting a 4,256,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2. Nguyễn Thị Bé (20206020033) is a 36-year-old woman who is requesting a 2,016,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

3. Nguyễn Thị H. (20206020034) is a 57-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

4. Nguyễn Thị T. (20206020035) is a 32-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

5. Hoàng Thị L. (20206020036) is a 49-year-old woman who is requesting a 4,256,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

6. Nguyễn Thị H. (20206020037) is a 40-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

N. Kiều Thị B. (20206020031) là 23 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. N. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Đồng Nhân 1 - Nhóm 05 (Nhóm 05).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên T. nhập, mà nguồn T. nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán các loại thực phẩm khác nhau trong cộng đồng địa phương. N. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 2 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, N. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND. Vào 2008, N. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. N. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.256.000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.496.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1. Trần Thị C. (20206020032) là 25 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.256.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

2. Nguyễn Thị Bé (20206020033) là 36 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 2.016.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

3. Nguyễn Thị H. (20206020034) là 57 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

4. Nguyễn Thị T. (20206020035) là 32 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

5. Hoàng Thị L. (20206020036) là 49 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.256.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

6. Nguyễn Thị H. (20206020037) là 40 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.

Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có T. nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Badenya sont des femmes, mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygames avec en  moyenne 40 ans et 5 enfants. Elles  habitent toutes  à Togo, un des villages de la préfecture de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et font le commerce d’articles divers.
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce  tout en diversifiant leurs activités génératrices de revenus, elles ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Après 5 prêts solidaires tous correctement remboursés, elles sont à leur 6ème  prêt, qu’elles comptent utiliser pour acheter, 200 mortiers, 10 chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffe et 289 sacs de charbon de bois. Elles s’approvisionnent en charbon de bois et bois de chauffe auprès des jeunes du village, en mortiers avec les forgerons du village et de ceux de Noumou Wêrê un village situé à 7 km. Elles revendent au comptant et à crédit à domicile, en ambulant et au grand marché de Ségou à une clientèle mixte. 
Elles envisagent  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.650FCA qui sera utilisé dans le remboursement du prêt et les petits besoins de la famille. 
Elles ont pour ambition d’acheter des bœufs de labour afin d’augmenter leurs parcelles de culture.
texts.en:
The members of the Badenya group are women, married for the most part in polygamous families, and on average 40 years old with five children. They all live in Togo, one of the villages in the Segou prefecture (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They got to know each other as neighbors or through family ties, and are retailers of various products. To increase their working capital and diversify their revenue-generating activities, they decided to join Soro Yiriwaso. After five group loans all correctly reimbursed, they are now requesting a sixth loan, which they will use to buy: 200 mortars, 10 cartloads of firewood, and 289 bags of charcoal. They get the charcoal and firewood from village youths, and the mortars from blacksmiths in the village or from Noumou Wéré, a village seven kilometers distant. They retail their products for cash or on credit, from their home, as itinerant vendors or at Segou’s main market, to both men and women customers. They hope to attain average monthly earnings of 25,650 FCFA each, which will be used to reimburse the loan, and for minor household expenditures. Their ambition is to buy oxen to enlarge their cultivated land-plots

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various products

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina es socia del Banco Comunal Anabella.
Alejandrina es casada, tiene 64 años y 7 hijos, Alejandrina junto a su esposo tienen un foto estudio en donD. brindan servicios D. filmaciones, fotografía, revelados, venta D. cámaras, rollos.
Alejandrina necesita un préstamo D. 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. materiales fotográficos.
El sueños D. Alejandrina es comprar un laboratorio minidigital.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is a member of the Anabella Community Bank. She is 64 years old, is married and has 7 children. Together with her husband, Alejandrina has a photo studio where they offer film and digital photo services and sell cameras and rolls of film. Alejandrina needs a loan of PEN 3000 that she will invest in the purchase of photographic materials. Her dream is to buy a mini-digital laboratory.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase photographic materials

loans.name: Pheouk

texts.en:
Pheouk S., age 53, is widowed and resides with her children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has two children. She is engaged in the agriculture sector, growing vegetables for sale, earning an income of USD 3 per day to help cover family expenses. The family is also assisted financially by one of her children who is employed as a housekeeper at a hotel, earning an income of USD 3 per day. 

Their standard of living has improved since S. has had this business. S. is requesting a loan of 600 USD to purchase a motorbike for her child to commute to work. This is her first loan from CREDIT, partnered with Kiva.

loans.use: buy a motorbike for her daughter to commute to work

loans.name: Liberato

texts.en:
Liberato T. is from the village of Brgy, Tuao North, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 50 years old and married with three adult children. To make a living, Liberato has a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been engaged in this business for over 15 years and earns approximately 35,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2010, Liberato joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Liberato is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the first loan he has taken out from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Enrequita

texts.en:
Enrequita S. is from the village of Waterfall, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 45 years old. Enrequita is married and has 10 school-aged children. To make a living, Enrequita owns & operates a specialized retail business selling a variety of products such as green bananas, chorizo, toccino, firewood and many more in the local community. Enrequita has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Enrequita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Enrequita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. Enrequita is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Enrequita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Rasul

texts.ru: Хасанов Расул проживает в районе Рудаки. Возраст, 52 года. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Жена, учительница. Сам Расул имеет высшее образование по специальности "Педагог". Работает по профессии. Кроме того занимается животноводством. Он в основном откармливает и продает скот. Этим видом бизнеса занимается более 4 лет. Кредит берет для закупа дойной коровы.
texts.en:
Rasul H. lives in the Rudaki district. He is 52 years old, married and has 2 children. His wife is a teacher. Rasul has a higher education with a specialty in teaching. He works in his profession. Besides, he is involved in animal husbandry. He primarily fattens and sells livestock. Rasul has been involved in this business for over 4 years. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of a dairy cow.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Kimanga Group

texts.en:
Meet Dr. Marysia K. and the Kimanga Group.  Marysia is 37 years old, married, and has a three-year-old daughter. Marysia studied to be a doctor, but before she started practicing medicine, she gave birth to her daughter who was premature.  She decided to stay home and care for her baby.  While at home, she decided to start her own catering business, which she did shortly after her daughter's birth.  

With a small amount of money from her husband, Marysia began buying some catering supplies and offering her services for events such as weddings and kitchen parties.  In 2009, her friend introduced her to Tujijenge Tanzania, and Marysia has now had three loans.  With the previous loans, Marysia bought tablecloths and fabric for decorations, serving dishes, buffet tables, plates, a charcoal cooker, and a gas cooker.  This has allowed her to grow her business, which now employs 8-10 staff.  Profits vary depending on the number of events Marysia caters, but can be up to 3,000,000 Tsh per month (about $2100).  

This is Marysia's first Motisha loan. A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended.  Marysia has some big events coming up, and she will use this loan to buy extra drinking glasses and fabric for decorations.  Marysia dreams of growing her business and if she makes a profit from this loan, she will save to buy a music system, and someday to make a trip to China to buy more catering and decoration supplies. Marysia also recently started working as a medical doctor during the week, and greatly enjoys her two different types of work. 

Marysia is the President of the Kimanga Group.  The 10 group members will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan. In the photo, Marysia is the middle of the back row, wearing a striped polo shirt.

loans.use: To buy glasses and decorations

loans.name: Mrs. Sokkhoeurn Kem Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sokkhoeurn K. is a village bank president who has been selected by twelve members located in Veal village in Kandal province. Each of the members will use a portion of their loan for different purposes, to improve their businesses. Mrs. Sokkhoeurn K. was born in 1972. She is a farmer who owns one-hectare of land to cultivate rice to sell, to support her family. She is a pig breeder too. Now she has some problems because her pigs are too small to sell. So to improve breeding pigs, Mrs. Sokkhoeurn K. is applying for a loan to buy pig food. With rest of the loan, she wants to buy rice to make white wine to start a new business. She is a widow with three children, one is a construction worker, another one is a seamstress in a garment factory, and the third is attending a local public school.

loans.use: To buy pig food.

loans.name: María

texts.es: María, de 40 años de edad, es divorciada y tiene dos hijos en su haber, Ángel y Patricia de 9 y 3 años respectivamente. Juntos viven en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tienen su propia casa. María se caracteriza por ser una mujer con carácter y muy competitiva, a pesar de que tuvo percances en el camino, supo sobresalir. Hace mas de 5 años trabaja de forma independiente, desde entonces vende ropa para el público en general, y considera que este trabajo lo esta beneficiando de forma positiva, ya que sus ventas aumentaron, pues gracias a la clave de su éxito, que es la calidad y el precio de sus productos. Usualmente trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su hijo, siendo su punto de venta en el mercado de su misma localidad. Ella es consciente de que le falta mucho por escalar, es por ello que piensa tener su propia tienda en la avenida principal de su localidad, con la finalidad de vender toda variedad de ropa, según lo gustos y preferencias de sus clientes. Este es su decimoquinto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a pagar de manera puntual, además reconoce que pertenecer al grupo comunal, le esta dando muchas ventajas.Con el crédito que solicita,  piensa invertir en adquirir mayor cantidad de ropa de última generación, con la finalidad de estar a la par con la modernidad y el estilo cambiante de sus clientes.
texts.en:
María is 40 years old. She is divorced and is raising two children, Angel and Patricia, 9 and 3, respectively. They live together in the community of Quimbiri, located on the edge of the Peruvian jungle, where they have their own house. María is described as being a woman of character and very competitive. Despite mishaps a long the way, she has been able to overcome. She has been working independently for more than five years and during that time she has been selling clothes to the general public. She believes that this job is benifitting her in a positive way. Her sales have increased, thanks to the quality and price of her products. Usually, she works on her own, but at times, her son helps her. Her point of sale is in the market of the same community. She is aware that she a lot more to acheive. That is why she is planning on having her own store on the main avenue of her town. The idea is to have every type of clothing, according to the tastes and preferences of her customers. This is her fifteenth loan with MFP and she is committed to making her payments on time. She also recognizes that belonging to the communal group is giving her a lot of advantages. With the loan that she is asking for, she plans on investing in a larger quantity of the lastest clothing, in order to be up to date with the changing styles of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more clothing with modern designs

loans.name: Basem

texts.en:
Basem, who appears in the photograph, is a 21-year-old young man from Tulkarem. Basem's family members have been farmers for a long time. Basem had to leave school and join his father in working and taking care of the family. Two of Basem's brothers are government employees and they help with the family's expenses.

Basem, who is regretting leaving school, is engaged now and needs a $2,400 loan to cover some of the wedding expenses. Basem decided that he will take another loan after repaying the current one so he can resume his education. He believes that education will help him get a good job and, in addition to working on the farm with his father, will improve his financial situation.

loans.use: Cover wedding expenses

loans.name: Benkadi  2 Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi 2 est regroupement de huit femmes mariées majoritairement dans des grandes familles traditionnelles, qui ont en moyenne 27 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent le village de Korobougou dans la commune rurale de Sébougou dans la 4ème région administrative du Mali, qu’est Ségou et se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage et de parenté. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs superficies de culture pendant l’hivernage, elles ont fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er  cycle de prêt de campagne. Les membres du groupe vont cultiver dans l’ensemble de l’arachide, du mil et du sésame.
Madame Foufa  B. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 30kg de semence d’arachide, 2 sacs de complexe céréale,  recruter la main d’œuvre pour les activités de labour et de sarclage dans ses champs. 
Elle se ravitaille en intrants à la foire de Ségou. Les activités de labour des champs sont l’œuvre des hommes alors que celles du désherbage sont effectuées par l’association des femmes du village. 
Sur une superficie de 3 hectares, elle compte récolter 5 sacs de mil, 18 sacs d’arachide et 2 sacs de sésame. Les céréales et une partie de l’arachide sont auto consommées tandis que le sésame et le reste d’arachide sont vendus. 
Le bénéfice obtenu est utilisé pour assurer les besoins du foyer, la scolarisation et les soins de santé des enfants.
texts.en:
"Benkadi 2" is a group of eight married women mostly in large traditional families. The women average 27 years of age and two children living in the village of Korobougou, in the rural community of Sébougou, in the 4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali which is Segou. They know one another through ties of marriage and kinship. With the goal of increasing their arable land during the winter, they turned to the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first farm loan cycle. The group members over all are going to grow peanuts, millet, and sesame. Ms. Foufa B. intends to use her loan for buying 30 kg of peanut seeds and 2 sacks of cereals fertilizer and for recruiting manual labor for plowing and weeding in the fields. She restocks her supplies at the Segou fair. Plowing the fields is men's work, while weeding is done by the women's association of the village. From three hectares of land, she plans on harvesting 5 sacks of millet, 18 sacks of peanuts, and 2 sacks of sesame. The grains and a portion of the peanuts are consumed at home, while the sesame and the remainder of the peanuts are sold. The profits obtained will be used to cover household needs, schooling, and health care for the children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fertilizer (for grains) and peanut seeds and using manual labor for plowing and weeding.

loans.name: Sixta

texts.en:
Sixta R. is from the village of Lanna, Solana, Cagayan. She is 42 years old. Sixta is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Sixta owns and operates general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Sixta has been engaged in her business for over 40 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Sixta joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sixta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. Sixta is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Sixta from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees for her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie V. is from the village of Parog Parog, Solana, Cagayan. She is 48 years old. Josie is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Josie owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising vegetables for sale. Josie has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2300 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Josie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josie is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Josie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Shafqat's Group

texts.en:
Shafqat lives in Gujranwala which is an industrial city of Pakistan. She is a 37-year-old lady who has given birth to three daughters and two sons. All of them are attending school and getting their education except the youngest one who is just 18 months old.

Shafqat’s husband’s name is B. K. and he has a business selling crockery. He sells both plastic and glass crockery sets to his customers and generates an income for the family. He also supplies dinner sets of plastic and glass to different crockery sellers for a good profit.

Shafqat has applied for a loan for her husband from Kiva partner, Asasah. With the loan he will buy more crockery sets to increase his sales. Shafqat is hopeful that this investment will prove beneficial for her husband’s business and that he will make a good income from it and be able to improve the living standard of his family.

Shafqat is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 4th loan. In previous years she has proved herself as a very dependable client who always paid her installments on time and never missed a meeting.

loans.use: To enable her husband to buy more crockery sets for his business

loans.name: Virginita

texts.en: Virginita A. is a married woman who lives in Purok 1, Brgy. Tiling, Cauayan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by fishing. Her husband Ronel, age 41, works as a carpenter to earn his living and also helps with his wife's business. They have five children who are 3 to 18 years old. Virginita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, and by the sweat of her brow, Virginita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of 9,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of 4,000 PHP, thus improving the family's standard of living. This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing 12,000 PHP which she intends to use for the maintenance of her fishing gear so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Virginita A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To fund operations

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle L. is 39 years old, married and supports her family by operating two businesses: fishing and fish vending. She lives in Purok 1 in the barangay of Culipapa, Hinobaan municipality in Negros Occidental province on the Mindanao islands. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fishing and fish vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6000.

Anabelle is now borrowing PHP 17,000, her seventh loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon, to purchase fishing gear and equipment. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Anabelle aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure its future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a dollar a day to achieving realities beyond their dreams. They are on a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon—a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: This is fifty-year-old Hawa K.. Born in Yogomaia, a village near Kabala, this wife and mother of five children is a small-scale businesswoman in Kabala town. Hawa K. wants a loan of SLL 3,000,000 to invest in her business. She sells husk-rice, ground-nuts, and palm oil. She has been in business for ten years now. Hawa travels to a village called Firawa to buy the goods she sells. With the help of this loan, she will buy husk-rice, groundnuts, and palm oil in large quantity to sell.

loans.use: Buy husk-rice, groundnuts, and palm oil in large quantity to sell

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 22  años de edad,  es soltero, vive en casa propia con su padres.
Jorge empezó desde muy joven a trabajar como guarda de la Empresa de Transporte Paraguarí y la venta de leche, luego de adquirir un poco de capital emprendió una nueva labor la de macatero, que lo realiza todos los días después de trabajar como guarda y los fines de semanas en la ciudad de Paraguarí y las compañías cercanas a la ciudad.
Jorge es un joven muy sacrificado quién siempre tuvo que trabajar para ayudarle a sus padres  y hermanos para salir adelante y mejorar la calidad de vida, pues son personas muy humilde.
Necesita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías, por que gracias a su esfuerzo y a la calidad de sus productos cuenta con  una considerable demanda.
texts.en:
Jorge is 22 years old.  He is single and lives in his own home with his parents.

Jorge began working from a very young age as a guard with the Paraguayan Transport Company and also selling milk.  Then he acquired a little capital and began a new job as a travelling salesman which he does every day after he finishes his work as a guard and on weekends, in the city of Paraguarí and in companies near the city.

Jorge is a very selfless young man who has always had to work to help his parents and his siblings get ahead and improve their quality of life since they are very humble people.

He needs this loan to buy merchandise because, thanks to his hard work and the quality of his products, his products are in pretty high demand.

loans.use: To buy merchandise (t-shirts, jeans, sneakers, etc.)

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is thirty-three years old.  He is married and he lives with his wife and their two children in the small town of Yencala Boggiana near the city of Lambayeque.  It is a rural area which is primarily populated by small farmers of animals.

For three years, Jose has raised animals in the yard behind his home.  He raises ducks, chickens, turkeys and other animals.  He also works as a stevedore for a local private company, where he earns a stable salary.  Jose’s wife is a seamstress.  She sews for local families and also produces clothing for sale in the markets.

The requested loan will be used to purchase additional animals and feed in order to expand the family's livestock business.  They hope to be able to increase their income and assets so as to better provide for the education of their children.  Jose is dedicated to the success of his children and works hard every day to ensure that their future is bright.

loans.use: To purchase additional animals and feed

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a charcoal sales business for the past five years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Elizabeth faces a major challenge of theft in her business. She hopes to establish a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase 10 bags of charcoal for sale. She decided to join Yehu because of the good reputation of the organization in society.

loans.use: To purchase 10 bags of charcoal for sale

loans.name: Noe

texts.es:
El Señor Noe F., es agricultor, tiene 31 años de edad, vive en la Comarca Cerco de Piedra, La Concordia, en Estelí, casado y tiene 3 hijos; con mas de 15 años de experiencia en este sector. Inicio su experiencia a la de 14 años, con sus padres y hermanos, quienes le daban una pequeña ayuda para sus gastos personales.
Decidió independizarse a los 18 años, su Papa le regalo 2 pequeños terrenos que le sirvieron para empezar y obtuvo su primer crédito. Comenzó sembrando Cebolla y también se dedica a la Compra Venta de Ganado; esta ultima actividad la hace en pequeña escala, los ingresos que obtiene son para los gastos de la casa.
Con este crédito el quiere comprar insumos para siembra de Cebolla; el piensa que su cultivo será mas vigoroso, para ofrecerlo al mercado en mejor precio.
texts.en:
Noe F. is a farmer.  He is 31 and lives in the Cerco de Piedra region, La Concordia, in Estelí.  He is married and has 3 children.  Noe began farming with his parents and brothers 14 years ago and his family would give him a little money for personal expenses.
He decided to go out on his own when he was 18 and his father gave him 2 small fields that he used to begin, and he took out his first loan.  He started planting onions and he also started buying and selling cattle.  He does the latter on a small scale-the income he uses for household expenses.

With this loan he would like to buy supplies to plant onions. He thinks that his crop will be stronger and he can sell it at the market for a higher price.

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline O. is from the village of Taboc Sur, Oroquieta City. She is 49 years old, married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Evangeline owns and operates a fishing business selling seafood, such as fish and shrimp, in the local community. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Evangeline joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from GDMPC. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Sokny

texts.en:
Mr. Sokny C., 32 years old, and his wife, Mrs. Kemsreang Yang, 31 years old, live along National Road 5, about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 2001 and have two children, a son and a daughter. One child attends school and the other is still young. 

Sokny is a rice farmer and a fisherman. His wife sells slush, or shaved ice dessert, in her village. Sokny is asking for a loan of $600 to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his rice farm. He will also use the loan to connect his house to a private electricity utility service.

loans.use: for farming supplies and for connecting his house to electricity

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es: Raquel tiene 32 años, es separada y vive con su hijo en casa de sus padres. Se dedica a la agricultura desde que era una niña, sus padres le enseñaron a cultivar la tierra y  hoy se ha convertido en su fuente de ingreso económico. Todos los días se esfuerza por lograr mejorar su casa, ayuda bastante a sus padres, en la siembra y al mismo tiempo cuida de los suyos, ya que cuenta con sus propios terrenos cultivando papa, maíz y alfalfa. Para ella es un gran apoyo que su familia participe de la temporada de cosecha y siembra. Su cosecha lo lleva a vender al por mayor en el mercado de su zona, de esa manera es más rentable sus ventas con mayores ganancias. Su deseo es tener más extensiones de terreno para seguir adelante. Es su noveno crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para sembrar papa y alfalfa.
texts.en:
32-year old Raquel is separated and lives with her son in her parents’ house. She has worked in farming ever since she was a young girl. Her parents taught her how to farm, and today this is how she earns her living. Every day she makes an effort to make improvements to the house, and she helps her parents a great deal in their fields as well as her own where she grows potatoes, corn, and alfalfa.

It helps Raquel greatly that the whole family participates at seed sowing and harvest time. She sells the produce at the local wholesale market. It’s a profitable business and she gets a good income from it.

Raquel’s goal is to acquire more land so she can have a better future. This is her ninth loan with Kiva partner MFP. She is happy to know that she has this financial support; she has always been very responsible with the repayments. Guillerma is grateful to be part of her community bank because all the members are responsible committed people. Likewise she is grateful to the donors who provide the loan money which will help greatly with the progress of her farm. 

She plans to use the loan to buy bags of fertilizer for the potato and alfalfa crops.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Maria Liza

texts.en:
Maria Liza is a 25-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a sari-sari (general) store and a farming business. She lives in Ilog, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her sari-sari (general) store and farming businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 3,000. Maria Liza is borrowing PHP 15,000 to purchase more stock to sell. This will be her fifth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Maria Liza aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team  http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: As additional capital for her general store & to buy fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Sagheer

texts.en:
Sagheer is 42 years old and has given birth to four children. All of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education.  She does embroidery and stitching work at her home. She receives orders from her neighboring clients and completes the orders to earn an income for her family.  She belongs to Kasur, which is a small city of Punjab, Pakistan, which is famous for its leather industry. She has lived there for the past eighteen years in a small home which contains two rooms in the area of Bhutta sohan din.

Her husband’s name is Y. and he has two businesses. He supplies construction material to different construction companies on order. In addition, he sells animals to butchers after raising them up.
 
Sagheer has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, to further expand her husband’s construction supplies business. With the loan, he will buy cement, sand and bricks in larger quantities to be able to fulfill larger orders and earn better profits. He has been operating this business for the past fourteen years, and Sagheer is hopeful that an investment will bring even more profits to him. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she proved herself a responsible client who never missed a single meeting and paid installments on time.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and bricks for resale

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda M. is from the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 45 years old. Imelda is married and has 12 school-aged children. To make a living, Imelda owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling canned goods, junk foods, detergents, shampoo, soap and biscuits in the local community. Imelda has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Imelda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, junk foods & instant noodles. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Imelda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, junk foods & instant noodles

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma D., from the city of Gala, Ozamis City, is 46 years old, married, and has 10 grown children. To make a living, Elma has been planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale for over two years, earning approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Elma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan from GDMPC, she is now requesting her second loan for 15000 PHP to purchase more seedlings and fertilizers. Elma plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Hortencia Margarita

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Valroc. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable y trabajadora.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Hortensia, tiene 62 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen nueve  hijos todos mayores de edad, el menor de ellos vive en su casa y estudia en universidad, con ella también vive una hija que es madre soltera junto a su hijo pequeño. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella junto a su esposo tiene un negocio de cibercafé y cabinas telefónicas en el que también vende bocadillos de picar, sodas, jugos de frutas y otras golosinas. Trabajan todos los días desde las 8h000 hasta las 21h00, en este negocio también ofrecen el servicio de tipeado de trabajos en computadora y venta y recargas de teléfonos móviles. Nos cuenta que llevan 15 años dedicada a esta actividad. 

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su negocio con bocadillos, colas, golosinas y para pagar la mensualidad del internet que es lo más ganancias les deja. Está en el Banco Comunal casi desde el inicio y le gusta por la seriedad de la institución ya que el crédito siempre les llega cuando lo necesitan.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que este crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank named Valroc meets in the city of Rocafuerte every two weeks. This place is known for its delicious sweets prepared by the locals that are known throughout the country and for the warmth of the kind and hardworking people.

Here we meet Hortensia. She is 62 years old, married, and she has nine children from her relationship, all of whom are grown. The youngest of her children lives at home and he is in university. She also lives with one of her daughters and her young son as she is a single mother. Her husband is a merchant.

She and her husband have an internet cafe and telephone booths and they also sell snacks, soft drinks, fruit juices, and other snacks. They work every day from 8am to 9pm. They offer typing services and they sell cell phones and prepaid cell phone cards. She says that they have 15 years in the business. 

This loan will be used to supply her business with snacks, cola drinks, and sweets and to pay for the monthly internet access fees which are what yields the most earnings. She has been with the communal bank almost from its beginning and she enjoys partaking for the seriousness of the organization. The loan is always ready when they need it. 

Her goals are to keep up her business and to make it grow more every day.

loans.use: to purchase snacks, soft drinks, sweets and to pay the monthly internet access fee.

loans.name: Ariunselenge

texts.en:
is 38 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Hovd Province, Mongolia. All her children, aged 10, 13, and 16, attend local secondary school. Her husband, Tserendorlig, is a taxi driver who manages his own taxi service business. In addition, her husband works as a welder during summer seasons.

Ariunselenge manages a Mongolian traditional clothing (Del) making business in her town. She started her business in 2008. Now she makes variety of colorful, stylish and modern Del that fulfill her customers' individual requests. Besides her manufacturing operation, she also sells collections of sheets and cotton. 

Ariunselenge is a polite woman who is trying hard to feed her family. She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a workshop for her business.

loans.use: To purchase a workshop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, cheese, etc.

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Las Exitosas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a don Luis, tiene 56 años de edad, está separado pero de esa relación de tantos años tuvieron dos hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad  e  independientes. El lleva cuatro ciclos en el banco comunal y está muy contento ya que sus compañeras son muy amables y divertidas.

El es artesano, hace varios años aprendió cerrajería con la práctica, luego cuando ya aprendió lo necesario puso su propio taller de cerrajería, en su taller elabora todo tipo de trabajos pero lo mas hace son muebles en hierro a los cuales les manda a tapizar para luego entregarlos a los clientes que le realizan los pedidos. Trabaja de lunes  a viernes desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00 y los sábados de 8h00 hasta las 14h00. Nos cuenta que lleva 30 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
 
Este crédito es para comprar materia prima como: hierro, sueldas y pinturas para elaborar sus obras.

Sus sueños son que no le falte trabajo y gozar de buena salud.
texts.en:
The village bank "Las Exitosas" meets every 15 days in the canton of Montecristi, which is known for its rich precolonial culture and for its crafts, which are nationally and internationally recognized. Their straw hats are famous.

Here we meet Luis, 56, separated after many years with his wife, with whom he has two grown and independent children. He has been through four cycles with the village bank and is very happy because the other members are very friendly and fun.

He is a craftsman. Some years ago he learned to be a locksmith through an apprenticeship, and later when he had learned enough he opened his own workshop. In his workshop he makes all kinds of things, most especially iron furniture which he sends off to be upholstered before turning them in to the customers that placed the order.
