He works Monday to Friday from 8:00am til 6:00pm and on Saturday from 8 until 2. He tells us that he has been doing this work for 30 years.

This loan is to buy prime materials like iron, wages, and paints to make his pieces.

His dream is that he won't lack for work and will enjoy good health.

loans.use: to buy iron, solder and paint.

loans.name: Hanifaan's Group

texts.en:
Hanifaan has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her business sewing clothes. She is a very hardworking lady and operates her business full-time. She receives orders from her neighbor clients and fulfills them on time to earn profits for her family. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine that will allow her to complete orders in less time and earn more profit. 

Hanifaan started this business after the death of her husband. She is the mother of seven children. Her eldest son works at a private mill for a low income. The second one has a construction supplies business, while the third one works in a factory. Her elder daughter is also a seamstress and supports her mother in her business. Hanifaan’s remaining children stay at home. She couldn’t educate them due to financial constraints.

Hanifaan is hopeful that by investing this loan in her business she will be able to improve its condition and increase her profits. She is a regular user of Asasah loans and this is her second loan application. In the previous loan year, she paid her installments on time and never missed a meeting. 

In the photo, the lady with a book (an Asasah passbook) is Hanifaan.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for a sewing business.

loans.name: Víctor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor Manuel tiene 38 años, es soltero  vive con su hijo, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 1 hija Katherine de 13 años.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. VALLE ALTO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Voluntad de Dios en el Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra maíz y arroz.


Víctor se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, Compra sus productos en el Comercial Peña y vende sus productos en el mercado mayorista de ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para mejorar su producción  y suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es comprar un terreno para su hijo. Enfrenta el desafío de la sequia.

Le gusta trabajar y practicar deporte.
texts.en:
Víctor Manuel is 38 years old. He is single and lives with his child in the Ventanas canton in Provincia de los Ríos. He has one 13-year-old daughter.

The V.R.C. Valle Alto [Valle Alto community bank] is located in the Voluntad de Dios precinct of the Ventanas canton. This community bank is devoted to short cycle maize and rice growing agricultural works. 

Victor makes his living in agriculture, growing maize and rice. He buys his products in the Peña Store and sells his products at the Ventanas wholesale market.

He is requesting the loan to plant maize and rice, purchasing supplies and fertilizers for the crops. The support from this loan would help him economically to improve his production and supplement his needs. His dream is to buy a plot of land for his child. He faces the challenges of drought. 

He likes to work and play sports.

loans.use: tpo buy supplies and fertilizers fro his crops.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Phalla, 46 years old, is a photographer and also sells some vegetables at home. She is a single mother with 5 children.  Four are studying and one just finished studying motorbike repair. Every month, she has to spend $35 on food, $24 on school fee, and $10 for other expenses. 

She would like a loan of $900 to buy a camera for continuing her career. She wants to buy a modern camera so that she can take good photos for her customers. In the future, if she is able to save enough money, she would like to get a small shop for her son to do motorbike repairs.  She is afraid he might forget what he has learned from school. She wants to send the rest of her children to study in the university when they finish high school.

loans.use: To buy a camera for being a photographer

loans.name: Karisa

texts.en:
Karisa is a 38-year-old married father of four children. He is a livestock farmer.  His business has been in operation for the last three years. This is his first loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. 

With this loan amount, he plans to add more goats to his business. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and gradually expand his business. His dream is to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to add more goats to his business.

loans.name: Evelyn Milena

texts.es:
Evelyn Milena es una señora de 26 años de edad quien vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, en una pequeña comunidad llamada la Trinchera de Pital localizada en la provincia de Alajuela; cuyas principales actividades productivas son la ganadería y la agricultura, donde destaca el cultivo de la pina; siendo estas  comercializadas principalmente en los mercados internacionales. Por esta razón, el desarrollo de la comunidad ha venido creciendo en los últimos anos generando una mayor demanda de productos y servicios brindando mayores oportunidades de trabajo.
Ella tiene como herramienta de trabajo su camión y brinda sus  servicios a los vecinos de la comunidad, quienes se muestran muy satisfechos por la calidad.
Actualmente dona Evelyn está solicitando un microcrédito de 500,000.00 (quinientos mil colones), para la compra de repuestos para mejora de su camión además de ampliar y reforzar su local.
Con esta inversión espera que su proyecto crezca más, para poder atender a mas clientes y ofrecerles mejores servicio. Todo esto ayudara a mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Dona Evelyn es socia de la Empresa Comunal de Mujeres al Éxito de la Trinchera de Pital, una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con el espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico, además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Evelyn Milena is 26 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a small community called Trinchera de Pital located in the Alajuela province.  The principal activities in this area are raising cattle and farming, it is known for its pineapple crop, which is sold mainly in the international markets.  Because of this, the development of this community has been increasing in the last years  thus increasing the demand of products and generating more opportunities for work. 
Her truck is her work tool and she provides her services to the neighbors in the community which are very satisfied with the quality of her work.
Evelyn is currently requesting a micro loan of 500,000 colones for the purchase of parts to repair her truck and also to enlarge and reinforce her premises.
With these investments she expects to grow her project and be able to better serve her customers.  All of this will help to improve her quality of life.
Dona Evelyn is a member of the Community Venture of Successful Women of Trinchera de Pital, one of the 110 organization members of EDESA in Costa Rica.  This is her first loan and with this she expects to continue growing both personally and financially, and also actively participate in the credit organization in her community.

loans.use: to purchase parts for the improvement of her truck.

loans.name: Tonny

texts.en:
Tonny is a 52-year-old married man with three children. 

He has been in the taxi business for the past 26 years, with a monthly income of KES 14,000. 

He has been loaned KES 83,155 by KADET Ltd. This is his fourth loan. He intends to use about KES 30,000 to repair his taxi, and he intends to add the balance to his savings so that he can purchases a motorcycle with the intention of expanding his transport business. 

With the anticipated profit, he hopes to give his family a good life, continue running his businesses and save for future investments.

loans.use: To repair his taxi and purchase a motorcycle to expand his business.

loans.name: Iringo Twebiseho Group

texts.en:
Henry, who is 49 and a steadfast father of 10, has set the stage for growth in his sugarcane farming business in Ntungamo with his hard work, proficiency, and tenacity over the past year. The start-up capital for this business came courtesy of his prior carpentry business. To say the new business is "up and running" is the fairest of descriptions.

Needless to say, Henry still has a ways to go in the acquisition of solid-enough experience, but given his upbeat and open-minded attitude, he is on the inside track to make it. Weekly, his gross sales returns total 40,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX). The fact that he is able to sell his sugarcane to a nearby sugar factory is an advantage for his business.

Henry's auxiliary business is bricklaying. He intends to use his Kiva loan to give this side business a new lease on life. He intends to hire and pay more laborers to help him with the brickmaking.

loans.use: to hire and pay more laborers to help him make bricks

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
From 7:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m., Josephine is in her store attending to neighborhood customers who shop for their families. 

Her store has become a great opportunity for generating income, especially for her family.  Josephine started working to support her four children, most especially to pay their school fees.

Now she wants a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy different products so she can offer her customers more options, thus increasing her income.

In the future, Josephine hopes she will see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy sweets, beverages, cooking oil, and bread for her store.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 9 years now.

Evelyn requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat.   In the future, she would like to save money so that she can send her children to college.

loans.use: buy materials to maintain her fishing boat

loans.name: Tchangotade Group

texts.fr: Le groupe TCHANGOTADE est composé de trois personnes qui habitent dans la même maison. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Delphine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Delphine est âgée de 42 ans et vit au Bénin. Delphine est mariée à un agent de transport terrestre du nom de Antoine. Le couple à quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Delphine n'a jamais été à l'école. Afin de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Delphine vend depuis dix ans des vêtements et des bijoux.Delphine s’approvisionne au Bénin et au Togo son Etat voisin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu,Delphine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe TCHANGOTADE, un premier crédit.
texts.en:
The TCHANGOTADE group is composed of three persons who live in the same house. It's the first time that this group is asking for a loan from ALIDé to expand their activities. The representative of the group, Delphine, is the one who is raising her hand in the photo. 

 Delphine is 42 and lives in Bénin. She is married to a land transport agent named Antoine. The couple have four children, all enrolled in school and being cared for at home. 

Delphine never went to school. In order to support herself and her children, she has been selling clothing and costume jewelry for 10 years. She buys her goods in  Bénin and in Togo, a neighboring country. Wishing to satisfy the needs of her clientele and grow her turnover and thus her income, Delphine, together with the other members of her group TCHANGOTADE, is requesting her first-ever loan.

loans.use: to buy clothing and jewelry.

loans.name: Une Femme De Plus Group

texts.fr: UNE FEMME DE PLUS est un groupe de quatre personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Emilienne (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 34 ans et est mariée à un dessinateur nommé Edouard. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux sont à leur charge. Emilienne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Emilienne a très peu fréquenté l'école. Depuis environs huit ans, Emilienne vend des mèches et des produits cosmétiques dans son quartier. Emilienne achète ses produits au Bénin. C’est la quatrième fois que Emilienne et les autres membres du groupe UNE FEMME DE PLUS sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
"Une Femme de Plus" (One More Woman) is a group of four women whose members reside in the same neighborhood.

Emilienne, representative of the group and whose hand is raised in the photo, is 34 years old and is married to an artist named Edward. The couple has three children attending school, two of whom are dependents. Emilienne lives together with her ​​husband and children. The couple share the various household responsibilities.

Emilienne has had very little education. For about eight years, she has been selling locks and beauty products in her neighborhood. She buys her products in Benin.

This is the fourth time Emilienne and other members of the "Une Femme de Plus" group have requested the financial support of ALIDé to strengthen their working capital and business activities, and to better meet the demands of their customers.

loans.use: Buy locks and beauty products

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es: El Sr. Fernando cuenta con una tienda de Abarrotes, la cual es su única fuente generadora de ingresos que le ayudan a subsistir , por tal motivo la única manera de mejorar su calidad de vida es surtir su pequeña tienda de abarrotes ya que por estar en un lugar estratégicos cuenta una elevada demanda por lo tanto hemos el cliente ha tenido la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para poder mejorar su negocio . Fernando es una persona muy emprendedora que desea que la gente confíe en el para poderles demostrar que puede responder de forma responsable.
texts.en:
Fernando owns a grocery store and it is his only generator of income to help him subsist. For that reason, the sole means of improving his quality of life is to resupply his small grocery store. Since it is in a strategic location, it can count on an elevated demand for what he stocks.

Fernando needs to request a loan to be able to improve his business. He is a very enterprising person who wants people to have confidence in him and he wishes to demonstrate that he can respond in a responsible way.

loans.use: to restock and improve his grocery store.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia es socia del Banco Comunal “Kapia Marca” del distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 22 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y tiene un hijo, la señora estudió educación secundaria.

Trabaja desde hace tres años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que  invirtió en su negocio de venta de habas tostadas.

Solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizará para comprar veinte arrobas de habas, la señora los vende los jueves y domingos; ella trabaja sola debido a que su esposo trabaja como mecánico.

La señora desea mejorar su negocio y tener una casa propia.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the “Kapia Marca” communal bank in Yunguyo District and Province, Puno Department.  She’s 22 years old, has a live-in spouse and a son.  She completed secondary school.

She’s been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for three years.  Her first loan was for 500 new soles that she invested in her roasted lima bean business.

She is asking for a new, 500 new sol, loan to buy twenty arrobas of lima beans.  She sells them on Thursdays and Sundays.  She works alone because her husband works as a mechanic.

She wants to improve her business and have a house of her own.  What she likes best about her communal bank is the ease of the loan and the punctuality.

loans.use: to buy 20 arrobas of lima beans.

loans.name: Imani Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Imani SHG Group in Western Kenya! This group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Eunice is the facilitator of the Imani SHG group. She takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Eunice had an excellent maize yield harvesting fifteen bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Eunice was only able to harvest six bags of maize on one acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Eunice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Eunice will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Imani SHG Group will each plant  between half and one acre of maize.
The photograph shows Eunice and her group with the field officer on the far left.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina believes that "an optimistic person will have a bright future". She is 39 years old, married, and has two school aged children. Being a responsible parent, she aims to improve the standard of living and education of her children and to give them a better life. Despite hardships and problems in life, she has the confidence to improve the business. She owns and manages a variety store while her husband works in a private institution. 

She aims to increase her product offerings in her variety store to meet her customers' demands. But due to inadequate capital, she wants to ask for an additional of P50,000 to buy additional stocks of frozen foods, diapers, detergent powders, fabric softeners, and accessories to sell in her variety store. She believes that her loan will be a big help for her to improve the business and she is hoping that someday she will expand her business and become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of frozen foods, diapers, detergent powders, fabric softener, and accessories to sell in her variety store

location.town: Brgy. San Pedro, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Ledy Sirlendy

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Honduras 2000 se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo (Manta), este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ledy,  tiene  57 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos todos mayores de edad, una de sus hijas aún vive en su casa. Su esposo ya no trabaja está enfermo.

Ella  tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa, allí vende productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, entre otras cosas, además también vende productos naturales los mismos que vende en su local y algunas veces sale a entregar ya que la mayoría de sus productos los realiza a través de pedidos,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su hija y su esposo le ayudan cuando están desocupados. Su negocio es la única fuente de ingresos que tienen y gracias a Dios les da lo necesario para salir adelante, tiene su negocio ya por 15 años y  le ha ido bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes y productos naturales. Es fundadora del  Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ella puede seguir adelante en su negocio.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The Honduras 2000 Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the canton of Jaramijo (Manta). This place is known for the beautiful beaches that bathe its coastline. Most of the inhabitants are very hard working people who are engaged in sea-related activities for a living.

This is where we met Ledy, who is 57, married, and from this relationship she has three children, all of whom are of legal age, and one daughter still lives in her house. Her husband no longer works because he is ill.

She owns a grocery store in her house, where she sells products such as rice, sugar, oil and dishwashing liquid, among others. She also sells natural products at her store, and sometimes she delivers the products because she makes most of her products on a per order basis. She works every day from 6 AM through 8 PM, and sometimes even later. Her husband and daughter help her when they are available. Her business is their only source of income and thank God it has provided them with everything they need to get ahead.

She has had her business for 15 years and has done well. She will use this loan to provide her store with rice, sugar, oil, dishwashing liquid and natural products. She is a founding member of the Communal Bank and she likes it because the loans help her continue her business. Her goals are to continue her business and grow her store more and more each day.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, dishwashing liquid and natural products.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is 39 years old and married with two children. He does maize farming to earn a living. He has been in this business for 10 years and has employed one person.

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Benard has been able to save his income. He hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for a loan of 20,000 Kenya Shillings (KES) to buy maize seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy maize seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Franklin Giovanny

texts.es: Franklin es un hombre de 32 años, él considera como su pasatiempo el hecho de trabajar, debido a que disfruta mucho dedicarse a la actividad que realiza, la misma que consiste en el alquiler de sonidos y luces, ya que con su trabajo puede solventar los gastos de su hogar, el desarrolla esta labor durante toda la semana y es así como logra poder ofrecer sus servicios a un promedio de 5 clientes. Franklin sabe que este tipo de equipos son muy solicitados para fiestas o eventos especiales, también sabe que siempre hay que ofrecer un buen precio a sus clientes debido a la gran cantidad de competidores que existen en la ciudad de Ica, Perú, lugar en el que actualmente vive y trabaja. Él es consciente de que siempre hay que tener un dinero extra, es por esto que también trabaja como ayudante en una panadería. Franklin está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que es la tercera vez que le brindan su gran apoyo y podrá construir una pequeña habitación para poder guardar sus equipos de sonido, y de esta manera tener los equipos en un lugar más seguro; así Franklin seguirá luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:”Tener la mayor empresa de equipo de sonido de la ciudad”.
texts.en:
Franklin is a 32-year-old man.  He considers his work to be his pastime because he very much enjoys making a living at his job, which is renting sound and lights.  With his job he's able to pay his household expenses.  He does this job all week and is able to offer his services to an average of five customers.

Franklin knows that this type of equipment is frequently requested for parties or special events.  He also knows that he has to offer his customers a good price because of the large number of competitors in the city of Ica, Peru, where he currently lives and works.  He's aware that one should always have some extra money.  This is why he also works as an assistant in a bakery.

Franklin's very grateful to the Kiva lenders because this is the third time they've been a big help to him, and he'll be able to build a small room to be able to store his sound equipment and have it in a safer place.  This way Franklin will continue striving every day to make his biggest dream a reality: "To have the biggest sound-equipment business in the city."

loans.use: to build a room

loans.name: Nzokou

texts.fr: jean est un camerounais de 46 ans. père de 03 enfants dont le plus âgé 08 ans et le moins âgé 04 ans ( les 03 vont à l'école), Jean est cordonnier dans un quartier de la place depuis près de 08 ans. disposant d'une ponceuse vétuste, il souhaite avec l'argent du crédit acheter une nouvelle ponceuse et le cuir pour arranger les chaussures. les bénéfices seront réinvestis dans l'activité et lui permettront d'assurer le bien être de sa famille
texts.en:
Jean is a 46-year-old Cameroonian. father of three children, the eldest of whom is eight years old and the youngest four years (all three attend school),

Jean has been a shoemaker in the local neighborhood for nearly eight years. Saddled with a dilapidated sander, he will use the loan money to buy a new sander and leather to repair shoes with.

The profits will be reinvested in the business and also enable him to ensure his family's well-being.

loans.use: buy a sander and leather

loans.name: Enagnon Hinde Group

texts.fr: ENAGNON HINDE est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Solange est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Solange âgée de 29 ans a très fréquenté peu l’école. Solange est mariée à menuisier du nom de Victorin. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un scolarisé et tous à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Solange et son mari. Pour cette raison, Solange vend des pâtes alimentaires, des jouets, des fruits de saison et des boîtes de conserve depuis sept ans ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Solange s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Solange sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe ENAGNON HINDE, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des fruits de saison et des pâtes alimentaires.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline, at heart, is a resourceful, loving mum. Her motherly love has been enough to show him that she needs to work hard to help her children get ahead with excellent values and education. Jackline is a smallholder farmer in the Cherengany, Kitale area of Kenya. In the past ten years, she has bred more than one dairy cow and has developed her farm. Jackline was unable to study to get a professional career because of the economic situation that her family faced. However, she never gave up and she has been practicing farming. Because of how much she likes farming, she has even nicknamed one of her cows, which makes him a very proud farmer, especially when she is milking her cows. Through his dairy cow, she is able to get between 5-10 liters a day, and this helps him support her family. Jackline also practices crop farming, but she has not been making good profits because of poor farming implements, and that is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm implements. Through the loan, she will be able to buy high-quality seeds, good fertilizer, and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques; using high-quality seeds will assure him of a bumper harvest and hence, increased profit levels. Jackline is visionary, and her goal for the season is to boost her crop production and be able to get more crop output than the previous year. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill. Jackline believes that through the loan, she will turn around her family life and be able to give her children a solid educational background. This loan will be Jackline’s way out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy farm implements

loans.name: Eva Marlen

texts.en:
Eva is 22 years old, she is a young, responsible and very hard-working woman, she has a beautiful son, for whom every day, she works very hard to cover all the home basic necessities. She wants to offer him a good education, so that, in the future he will be an honest and working person: For that reason she began her own business, it consist in lady clothes sales. She has 1 year in her business and it has allowed her to have an additional income to cover all the baby expenses; however her sales are limited because she doesn\\\'t have the monetary capital to purchase merchandise and support her bigger demand.

She requires a loan of $200 USD to purchase merchandise; this will allow her to have more clothes to sell. Eva says that these last months her sales have been increased due to the Christmas season that approaches, for that reason she doesn\\\'t want to lose the opportunity to increase the capacity of her business. She and her small son thank your support and affection.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Eva tiene 22 años edad, es una mujer joven, responsable y muy trabajadora, tiene un hermoso hijo por quien todos los días trabaja muy duro para cubrir las necesidades básicas del hogar. Ella desea ofrecer a su hijo una buena educación para que en el futuro sea una persona honesta y trabajadora: Por esta razón empezó su propio negocio con la venta de ropa para dama. Tiene 1 años en su negocio y esto le ha permitido tener un ingreso adicional para cubrir los gastos de su bebe, sin embargo sus ventas son limitadas porque no cuenta con el capital monetario para comprar mas mercancía y poderla vender.

Ella requiere de un préstamo de $200 USD para comprar mercancía; esto le permitirá tener más ropa para vender. Eva dice que estos últimos meses sus ventas se han incrementado debido a la temporada navideña que se avecina, por lo que no quiere perder la oportunidad de incrementar la capacidad de su negocio. Ella y su pequeño hijo agradecen tu apoyo y cariño.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Grace Ambain

texts.en:
Grace is married with four children. Her life style suddenly changed when her mother died and her husband’s salary was reduced as a result of the economic crisis that hit Cameroon. She found great difficulties, especially financial, in raising her children.

Faced with these new challenges Grace decided to take the bull by the horns, but inadequate capital was a major handicap and her lack of courage to join GHAPE was another issue. The cost of the services offered by GHAPE seemed too good to be believed.

In 2005 Grace joined GHAPE and has succeeded in providing her community with firewood for cooking, puff-puffs for breakfast, and snacks for school kids.

Given a loan of $800, Grace plans to increase her stock by buying flour, sugar, yeast, salt, palm-oil, logs, Mbuh (the sap from palm trees consumed locally as palm wine) and beer. She plans to fry puff-puffs in the mornings and evenings during the dry season, sell Mbuh and beer in the afternoon, and firewood 24/7.

Grace plans to repay her loan in 18 months. The first installment shall be made in the fourth month from the date of disbursement of loan.

loans.use: Selling of puff-puffs, Mbuh, and beer

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en: Gideon O. is a married father of four. He sells used clothes for a living. He intends to use the loan of 150 USD to diversify and expand his business to increase his profit margin.

loans.use: I will use the loan to expand and diversify the business.

loans.name: Maria De  Lourdes

texts.es:
Maria de Lourdes is a single mother with four children aged 11, 12, 15 and 17. For them, she began her own business selling cosmetics. She began selling her products to her friends and family but she quickly gained new clients and she now has a large group of customers. Maria has had to make efforts to maintain her family but the comfort of her children is her motivation on a day to day basis.

To sustain increasing demand from her clients, Maria is asking for a $ 150 credit to buy products and she pledges to give this sum back in 3 months. It is important for her family as this will help Maria to increase her sales and improve overall quality of life.

Translated from spanish by Arnaud Braud, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria de Lourdes es soltera y tiene cuatro hijos, de 11, 12, 15 y 17 años de edad, ellos fueron el motivo por el cual inició su propio negocio con la venta de cosméticos. Comenzó vendiendo sus productos entre sus conocidos y familiares pero pronto fue ganando más clientes y ahora tiene una extensa cartera. Maria ha tenido que esforzarse mucho para sacar adelante a su familia, pero el bienestar de sus hijos es lo que la impulsa a continuar día a día.

Para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, Maria está solicitando un crédito de $ 150 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Es importante en la vida de esta familia ayudando Maria a mejorar su calidad de vida y contribuyendo al crecimiento de su negocio.

loans.use: Buy cosmetic products

loans.name: Mónica Diana

texts.es:
I have over fourteen years dedicated to the business of sewing. This business has given me a way to help my three children advance in life. Thanks to God I have had a lot of work, but I am lacking fabric and thread to finish my orders. I am requesting a loan of $1,000 dollars for the purchase of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Tengo ya mas de 14 años dedicándome a al oficio de la costura. Este negocio me ha dado para sacar a mis tres hijos adelante. Gracias a dios e tenido mucho trabajo pero me esta haciendo falta tela y hilos, para terminar los pedidos que tengo. Solicito un préstamo de $ 1,000.00 Dlls para la compra de mercancía.

loans.use: Purchase thread and fabric.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.en:
Mr. Marcelino G., 55, is married and lives with his partner, with whom he has three children. Of the three children, two are married, so only the youngest still lives at home. Marcelino also looks after a niece of hers who is still in school and financially dependent on the Gonzalezes. His family is originally from the neighborhood of Artigas, which was abandoned one and a half years ago to make way for a dam to be built nearby. Her family had to leave everything in order to look for a better life elsewhere.

Marcelino owns a small grocery and butcher shop. Since he married and had children, Marcelino has fought to put his family first and provide them with the life they deserve. Today, his two older children are married and have families of their own. Thanks to his hard work, his store hs been successful. His store is located in a good neighborhood, which also helps the store do well.

He has asked for a loan so that he may buy a better quality and greater quantity of foods to sell in his store. These include sugar, flour, oil, noodles, meat, sodas and dairy products. In the last month, he has seen a greater demand for these products from his customers.

loans.use: To buy sugar, flour, oil, noodles, meat, sodas and dairy products.

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.en:
R. Shahnoza has a successful business selling cleaning goods. She used her first KIVA loan to put a roof over her place of business and to expand her stock. She said that KIVA lenders have given her the opportunity to make her living conditions better. Her business is going well and she makes a stable profit. She is requesting a loan of $1200 to further expand her stock before the New Year holiday.

Click here to see Shahnoza's first loan with Kiva and MLF MicroInvest: Business ID 8428

loans.use: To increase stock before the New Year holiday

loans.name: Ana Fortunata's Group

texts.en:
Ana Fortuna, Nieves and Sabina have been members of the community bank “Prosperidad” for 9, 8, and 12 years respectively.  All of the women are very happy with their experience in the community bank.  They say that the community bank helps them to be self-sufficient.  Through the community bank they have learned to save and run their businesses more efficiently as well as finding companionship.
And Fortuna is 42 years old and has three children aged: 14, 9, and 6.  She runs a school supply store from her house.  She has had this store for the past five years.   Before that she rented VHs tapes.  When tapes became less popular Ana was able to take out a loan from her bank and start a new business.
Nieves is 53 years old and has four adult children and four who have passed away.  She raises animals and sells them at the markets.  She has been doing this all of her life.
Sabina is 47 and has three living children who are 28, 25, and 19.  Three of her children have passed away.  Sabina travels around the region buying grains at various markets and then sells them in Ayacucho.  She has been doing this for the past eight years.  
Ana Fortuna, Nieves, and Sabina need loans of 200, 300, and 350 dollars respectively.  Ana needs to go to Lima to buy supplies and prepare for the upcoming school year.  Sabina hopes to expand her business with the loan.  Both she and Nieves would buy animals.
They all dream of a better life and a successful business.  Ana dreams of sending her oldest child to medical school.  Nieves hopes to open a second stand, and Sabina wants to continue expanding her merchandise and make sure that her children receive an education.

loans.use: Ana Fortuna, Nieves, and Sabina need loans of 200, 300, and 350 dollars respectively.  Ana needs to go to Lima to buy supplies and prepare for the upcoming school year.  Sabina hopes to expand her business with the loan.  Both she and Nieves would buy animals.

loans.name: Marach D(Vi) Group

texts.en: The leader of this small group is Hafuswa Namboozo.  She is currently in the business of selling new clothes and is requesting a loan to increase her stock of clothes. Hafuswa is 24 years old. Each week, Hafuswa makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to help her husband in the construction of their new house.  Previously, Hafuswa  had a loan from BRAC Uganda  in the amount of UGX 150000 in order to invest in her business, and the loan was paid back on time.  Hafuswa is joined in her small group by Hajara A., Fatuma J. and  Fatuma N.. Hajara A. has a business selling used clothes and wants to expand her business.  Fatuma J. is currently operating a  retail shop and wants a loan to purchase additional stock.  Fatuma N. operates a business selling used clothes and wants to expand the business.

loans.use: To expand clothing business

loans.name: Tabia

texts.en:
Tabia is 30 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 15,13 and 9 years old. Tabia sells timber. She started in 2006. Every day, she works from 6am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

In the past, Tabia has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more timber for her business.

loans.use: To buy more timber for her business.

loans.name: Mwanaidi's Tuaminiane Group

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is 31 years old and is a single woman. Mwanaidi is a cosmetics seller and she started her business in 2007. Everyday, she works from 7am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $170 from her sales.

In the past, Mwanaidi has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Bichai and Salama, who have businesses dealings in a cafe, soft drink sales, and snack sales.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Faustina Blas

texts.en:
Faustina Blas V. N. has a general store in the town of Carabamba high in the sierras of La Libertad Region. She placed the store in the front room of her home, which is situated on a corner of the Plaza de Armas in the center of town. She is well known in her community and has many loyal customers. She has over 20 years of experience and has the only store in town that sells specialty products like champagne and other liqueurs.

Faustina is 57 years old, married, and has 6 children. She loves working and helping her family. She and her supportive husband believe it’s important to have two incomes. She looks forward to growing her business and helping her grandchildren attend school.

A member of the community bank Alfa y Omega, Faustina is requesting a loan of s/1500 to repay over 4 months. She will use the loan to restock her store with all her best selling products.

loans.use: She will use the loan to restock her store with all her best selling products.

loans.name: Happiness

texts.en: Happiness E. is 30 years old, married and lives in the Alaba area of Lagos State, Nigeria. She makes a living sells foodstuffs such as rice, beans, nuts and palm oil. She has been in this business for the past 5 years, and taught herself how to run this type of a company. Happiness needs a loan of $425 to buy more items to sell. She says "thank you" to Kiva and the people who support her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items to sell

loans.name: Aokou

texts.fr:
Aokou A. is 32 years old, married, and the father of 2 children. He's a furniture maker in Assahoun, a village located approximately 50 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. He would like to use this loan to buy wood to manufacture and sell furniture. The sale profits will enable him to support his family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer.

Aokou A. est âgé de 32 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Il est menuisier à Assahoun, un village situé à environ 50 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il souhaite par ce crédit acheter des bois pour la fabrication des meubles. Les bénéfices qu'engendreront ces ventes lui permettront de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy wood to manufacture furniture

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married with a daughter named Darya. She runs a small café in Kahovka, Ukraine. Her business exhibits good economic characteristics and fundamentals. Tatyana has a unique talent for identifying new opportunities and determining appropriate growth policies for her business. She has been in the trade for 13 years. Presently, her turnover capital is over $2000. Her monthly net profit is about $500.  

Tatyana would like a loan of 2500 Grivnas ($550 USD) to generate additional profit. We believe her natural ability to please her customers -- guessing their needs and offering speedy and courteous service -- will help Tatyana to achieve her goals, sustain her success, and consequently win the entrepreneurial game.  

Note: This is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To generate additional profit

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is 35 years old. She is married with 3 children aged 8, 5, and 2 years old. She has owned and run her own shop since 2005. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Safia is now looking for a loan to buy more items to increase her current stock.

loans.use: To buy more items to increase her current stock

loans.name: St. Joseph Vocational Group

texts.en:
These people are the staff of the St. Joseph Vocational Institute, Magburaka, Tonkolili District, Northern Sierra Leone. The institute was founded in 1985 by the Catholics of St Joseph of Cluny, and is the only formal institution in Magburaka that is geared towards the development of girls and young women. Their goal is to educate them and develop skills that will enable them to become self reliant. Thus they offer courses like computer science, typing, agriculture, tailoring, dyeing, hair dressing, catering and weaving. They serve mainly girls who can not make it in the formal schooling sector.

This will be the second loan St. Joseph Vocational Institute is requesting from Kiva through SMT. Their previous loan was a great help to these teachers. Some of them invested theirs in business, others used theirs to settle their children's school affairs and others use theirs to buy pieces of furniture. 

Florence K. Y. is the head mistress of the school. Mrs. Y. (back right in pink) was born in Magburaka. She is 39 years old, married to a teacher and the mother of four children. Three of her children are in secondary schools and the fourth is in primary school. Mrs. Y. invested her previous loan in the education of her children. This time she would like to use part of it to buy herself a plot of land and the balance she will use in her children's schooling.

loans.use: Buy a plot of land and invest in the children's education

loans.name: Mrs. Phann Yoeurn's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan group, which consists of twenty-six members, is located in Preak Reang Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Phann Y. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. 

Mrs. Phann Y. is a pig breeder and is raising two pigs. Her husband, Mr. Pheth Mouv, is a fisherman who  gathers small fish, but does not have enough fishnets to catch the fish. Thus, his wife, Mrs. Phann Y., decided to ask for a loan to buy more fishnets for her husband's business. Mrs. Phann Y. has a child who is employed in a garment factory. 

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Thirteen members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more fishnets for her husband's business.

loans.name: Yem

texts.en:
Mrs. Yem L. is 27 years old, married and lives with her child in the Kampong Chhnang province of Cambodia. She owns a grocery store, earning US$3 a day. Her husband works as a rice miller and earns an income of about US$8 a day. 
Food prices have soared in the past year as inflation has gotten out of control in Cambodia. Unfavorable climate conditions have also played a factor in making the price of rice very high. 
Yem L. is requesting a loan of US$1200 to purchase additional rice and also increase her grocery store's inventory. They will purchase rice and remove the husk then resell it, making a profit. She is confident that this is a sound business venture and sees it as a tool to increase her income and raise her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase additional supplies of rice and general grocery inventory.

loans.name: Mr. Yarath Dy's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mr. Yarath D. is the village bank president of sixteen people in Sra Ma village in Kampong Cham province and all the members in this village bank will use the loan for different purposes. Mr. D., for instance, is requesting a loan to buy more piglets for his pig-breeding business and he hopes to increase his income after he sells the pigs. His wife, Mrs. Chi Sive Neang is a rice soup seller who is able to make a small income to support the family.  He is 37 years old and the father of three children who are attending the local school. 

About End-of-Term Loans:
One member in this village bank has an end-of-term loan and the rest have monthly payment loans. This first member is not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for pig-breeding business.

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
Diana es una madre joven de dos niños, uno tiene once años y la segunda, siete. Hace un año y medio, con el objetivo de ayudar a sus hijos con los gastos de sus estudios, hablo con su esposo sobre cómo podría generar ingresos extras al hogar. Es así que se anima a vender al inicio solo golosinas. Luego de un tiempo empezó a vender también bebidas como gaseosa y agua.

Poco a poco ha ido creciendo en su negocio, pero ella afirma que aún le queda mucho por hacer. Actualmente ella dedica sus ganancias a la reinversión. Más adelante le gustaría construir fuera de su casa un ambiente para su tienda ya que por ahora vende a la intemperie.
texts.en:
Diana is a young mother of two children, an 11 year old boy and a 7 year old girl. A year and a half ago, in order to help her children with their school expenses, she talked to her husband about how to generate an extra income. This way, she decided to start selling candy. After some time, she also began selling beverages, such as sodas and water. Little by little, her business began to grow, but she states that there’s still a lot to do. She currently re-invests all her earnings. In the future, she would like to build facilities outsider her house for her store, as currently her store is in the open air.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more products for her small store

loans.name: Sok-Heang

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok-heang, 49, and her husband, Mrs. Porn Khut, 54, married in 1981 and have nine children: four sons and five daughters. Three of their children are married and live outside the family home. Their eldest son is a construction worker and the other children attend school. The family lives on an island of the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Sok-heang and her husband have been farming since 1975. They grow rice, tomatoes and sweet potatoes in their farmland not too far from the village and sell their produce to a middleman in the village. Sok-heang is requesting her first loan of US$ 200 to purchase diesel for their water pump and fertilizer for growing rice.

loans.use: To purchase diesel and fertilizer for growing rice

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
One of the members of Paglaum under its Microfinance Program is named Fe G.. She is happily married to a fisherman and they were blessed with four children.

Fe is currently requesting a loan amounting to PHP 11,000 for the purchase of additional fishing net and other fishing materials for their fishing venture.

As a member she is always on time on her payments, giving weekly savings and attending meetings regularly. She is hoping that this loan would help augment their income as the main source for their living.

She dreams that someday she could enhance her fishing venture, acquire big fishing boats and other related fishing materials. She is also hoping that she could send all her children to college courses someday.

The family is so grateful for the support and concern of Paglaum for them as a family.

loans.use: purchase of fishing nets, etc.

loans.name: Dassigan

texts.fr: Mme Mme Dassigan A. est née en 1959 à Lomé, avec huit (08) personnes en charge. Après le décès de son mari, elle est la seule face aux charges du ménage. Très dévoué et entreprenante, elle initia la culture des champignons. C'est un produit alimentaire utilisé dans l'art culinaire tout comme le poisson ou la viande dans la préparation des sauces. Actuellement, la demande dépasse l'offre  mais elle n'a les moyens suffisants pour répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle. C'est pourquoi elle sollicite un financement pour acheter les outils de travail et tous les éléments qui entrent dans cette culture. Les bénéfices tirés lui permettront d'améliorer les conditions d'existence de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Dassigan A. was born in 1959 in Lomé and has eight people to support. After the death of her husband, she is alone in coping with household expenses. A very devoted and enterprising woman, she began growing mushrooms. This a food used in the culinary arts just like fish or meat is when making sauces. Currently, the demand exceeds the supply, but she lacks the means for responding to the requirements of her customers. This is why she's requesting financing for buying work tools and all the elements associated with this kind of farming. The profits derived will enable her to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To grow and sell mushrooms

loans.name: Sarmes

texts.en: Sarmes T. is a 45-year-old farmer who has been living in the Internally Displaced People Settlement with his two sons since 1991. He and his family suffered from Azerbaijan-Armenian conflict. He started livestock breeding in 1995 when poverty pushed him to find a source of income to cover his family's basic needs. Owing to the loan from AqroInvest, Sarmes could make his business successful. He regards himself as a trusted client and has now applied for his second loan from KIVA. He requests a loan of USD 1525 to purchase three calves for an estimated price USD 500 each. Let’s wish him good luck!

loans.use: to purchase three calves

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
Fortunata es socia del Banco Comunal Renacer.
Fortunata es casada, tiene 40 años y 2 hijos, Fortunata viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región 4 veces por semana, en donde vende abarrotes y de las ferias compra cereales, animales menores. Además Fortunata vende comida típica todos los días sábados y domingos.
Fortunata necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cerdo y cereales.
Los sueños de Fortunata son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y mejorar sus negocios.
texts.en:
Fortunata is a member of the Village Bank Renacer. Fortunata is married, 40 years old and has two children. Fortunata travels to different markets in the region four times a week, where she sells groceries and buys grains and small animals. Furthermore Fortunata sells traditional food every saturday and sunday. Fortunata needs a loan of 2000 soles that will be invested in the purchase of pork and grain. Fortunata's dreams are for her children to complete their studies and to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pork and grain.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Lucy M. from Mbeya. Lucy has been running a business purchasing and selling crops since 2001. She works at the business for 9 to 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Lucy currently earns about $120 US a month from her business. She is married with three children between the ages of 6 and 14. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase crops in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to open a new business. Lucy thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania through microleasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor coverage of basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk

loans.name: Wungeh Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is married and has five children. In Bailem, Cameroon, Joseph is an operator, and he cuts firewood using a chain saw. Firewood is used a lot in Cameroon, as most kitchens cook over open, wood-burning fires. His services are common. He will use this loan to purchase petrol (gas), engine oil, a chain saw and some sharps. Joseph says he is a hard worker and is kind to his customers. These characteristics are what he believes makes him a successful business owner. In his community, his business location allows his customers to trek shorter distances and it will enable him to employ local youth. This is Joseph’s second loan from GHAPE since he became a beneficiary in 2008. With the profits from this loan he will pay for his children’s school fees, save some money, rear pigs and perhaps buy some trees. Joseph takes out GHAPE loans because GHAPE documents his loans and is a truthful organization. About GHAPE The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy petrol (gasoline), engine oil, a chain saw and sharps

loans.name: Bebeliza

texts.en:
Bebeliza P. is a resident of Sebucao, Dumalinao, Zambaonga del Sur. She is now 53 years old, a widow with eight children and lives with her common-law husband who is helping her business. Four of her daughters have left to go abroad for a living.

Bebeliza loaned PHP 9,000 from Paglaum as additional capital for her business. Her business is progressing and she is now earning more than PHP 6,000 a month. Most of her clients are her neighbors and some are from the community. She dreams of sustaining her business with Paglaum as her financing partner.

loans.use: To purchase additional products for her business

loans.name: Sushila

texts.en:
Miss Sushila S. lives in Thikedewal which is located in Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this area are engaged in small businesses like grocery stores, small hotels, and stationery stores. 

Miss Sushila S. is engaged in her own small restaurant. She opens her restaurant to uplift the living standard of her family. Her mother also helps her in her restaurant.

She sells different types of food items in her shop. Especially, she sells Newari food in her shop because Newari food is very popular in this locality because the majority of the people in this region are Newars and Newari food is so delicious to eat. She also serves tea and coffee.

Now Sushila S. is requesting an Rs 15,000 loan to expand her business and to purchase necessary food materials.

loans.use: To expand her business and to purchase necessary food materials

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru: Рано Ризоева проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 40 лет. Разведена, имеет 3 детей. Рано более 5 лет занимается бизнесом, торговлей. Она имеет торговую точку на рынке, где торгует разными хозяйственными вещами. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Rano R. lives in the town of Vahdat. She is 40 years old. She is divorced and has three children. Rano has been doing business for more than five years, she is in retail. She has a vendor spot on the market where she sells different types of home products. She is asking for a loan to increase circulation of goods.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase circulation of goods

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia es socia del Banco Comunal Prosperidad.
Lidia es viuda, tiene 68 años y 8 hijos, Lidia venD. cereales variados, D. manera ambulatoria en el mercado Santa Clara, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Lidia necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. trigo, cebada, maíz.
Los sueños D. Lidia son mejorar su negocio y ayudar a sus nietos.
texts.en:
Lidia is a member of the Communal Bank “Prosperidad” (Prosperity). She is 68 years old, widowed, and has 8 children. She sells various grains as a traveling merchant in the Santa Clara market. Lidia engages in her business every day.

She needs a loan of 600 soles to purchase wheat, barley, and corn. Lidia dreams of improving her business and helping her grandchildren.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wheat, barley, and corn

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is a member of the Wazo borrower group in ilala,Iringa,she is 41 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children.Her children are aged 25,19, and 16 years.she also cares for other 2 dependents.

Magdalena started her own grocery business selling beer ,soda 11 years ago,she works 14 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 210,000 Tanzania shillings.


This is Magdalena`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 300,000 Tsh in order to buy more soda and beer.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Magdalena hopes to save money,pay school fees and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more beer,soda

loans.name: Uransaihan

texts.en:
Uransaihan G. is 44 years old, married and the father of four children ranging in age up to nineteen years old. His eldest daughter is a college student, the next two children are both in high school, while his youngest son is only a year old. The family currently lives in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces.

Uransaihan is a trained veterinarian and loves his job. Since 1996 he has been running a small veterinary pharmacy for domesticated animals, mostly for camels, horses, sheep, goats and cattle. He has been quite successful, as his pharmacy has increased its income from 200,000 MNT to 2,000,000 MNT (1,450 MNT = $1 USD) since its opening. Many local herders appreciate his business and are his loyal customers.

Uransaihan says that he would like a loan to expand his business by introducing up-to-date animal medicines for local herders. He would love one day to purchase his first family car. Buying a car has been his family's dream for the last decade. Uransaihan is resolved that this dream will come true one day.

loans.use: To buy up-to-date animal pharmaceuticals for his veterinary pharmacy

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.en:
Mr. Juan Carlos is married and has three small sons. Juan Carlos and his wife have a dinner restaurant. His wife helps in the kitchen and he attends to the clients. 

He has 16 years of experience selling antiques, but one day he wants to rent a plot of land to sell things. He is a very good entrepreneur and thinks it is very important to know about business. With the loan, he wants to buy soda, beer, oatmeal, and other things to sell.

loans.use: To buy soda, beer, oatmeal, and other things to sell

loans.name: Flor De Azucena Group

texts.es:
Brígida Fernández de 40 años dos días a la semana se levanta muy temprano para adquirir su mercadería en Desaguadero, porque los precios son menores, ella vende productos de plástico como bañadores, tachos, platos, vasos y otros, esta en el rubro hace 12 años, al inicio le costo levantar su negocio, pero poco a poco ha ido generando ingresos que le permita crecer y mejorar su negocio, con ese mismo entusiasmo hoy necesita otro préstamo para seguir comprando mercadería específicamente tachos. Brígida pertenece a la familia de Pro Mujer hace 9 años, pero por diferentes razones ha ido cambiando de grupo, actualmente esta en el grupo Flor de Azucena hace 2 años, este grupo realiza sus reuniones en el Centro Focal Panamericana.
Al igual que Brígida  las demás integrantes del grupo cuentan con diferentes negocios como la venta de verduras, alimentos secos, costura de polleras (falda), mandiles y tejido de mantas.
Todas la integrantes de este grupo necesitan el préstamo para la compra de  mercadería, insumos y materia prima.
texts.en:
Forty year old Brígida Fernández gets up very early two times a week to purchase goods in Desaguadero because the prices are lower. She sells plastic goods such as swimwear, containers, plates, cups, and other goods. She has been in this business for 12 years. At the start it was difficult to get the business off the ground, but little by little it has been generating income that permits her to grow and improve the business. With this same enthusiasm, today she needs another loan to continue buying goods, specifically plastic containers. Brígida has belonged to the Pro Mujer family for 9 years, but for various reasons her group has changed. Currently and for the last 2 years she is in the Flor de Azucena group. This group holds its meetings in the Centro Focal Panamericana.

Just like Brígida, the other members of the group have different businesses such as selling vegetables, dry foods, sewing skirts and aprons, and weaving blankets.

All the members of this group need the loan to buy merchandise, supplies, and raw materials.


Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise, supplies, and raw materials

loans.name: Roger

texts.es:
Roger es un simpático caballero de 47 años, vive junto a su familia, compuesta por su pareja Gloria de 44 años y sus hijas: Shirley de 22 y Gloria de 13 años. Ellos viven en su acogedora casa en una tranquila zona al sur de la ciudad de Lima.

Él se dedica al servicio de taxi, tiene un auto propio en el que trabaja durante todo el día, todos los días sin descanso. Desde hace 15 años se dedica a esta actividad porque le parece muy rentable, además la experiencia le ha hecho conocer a qué zonas debe dirigirse y a qué tipo de personas movilizar, y ha escogido trabajar de día porque es más seguro. 
Roger recuerda su antiguo trabajo con nostalgia, antes era obrero de construcciones pero después de un tiempo logró ahorrar dinero y pudo adquirir su auto, así es como se decidió a dedicarse al taxi, ahora puede trabajar tranquilo y mantener, sin problemas, a su familia. 
Este entusiasta taxista tiene la meta de llegar a tener una flota de taxis donde él sea el propietario y administrador, pero sabe que para llegar a concretar este objetivo debe esforzarse y trabajar con empeño, y ya ha empezado a proyectarse al futuro porque piensa refaccionar su actual vehiculo y asociarse con su cuñado para comprar un auto nuevo y entre los dos brindarlo en alquiler.

Roger es un hombre de negocios, por eso es muy responsable con cada uno de sus pagos, pues sabe que aunque este sea el sétimo préstamo que tiene con MFP debe seguir demostrando responsabilidad. Además, añade que es puntual porque sólo las personas que son así triunfan en la vida. Tiene planeado invertir el dinero que solicita en la reparación de su vehículo para poder trabajar tranquilo y brindarles seguridad a los diferentes pasajeros que día a día moviliza.
texts.en:
Roger is a likeable 47 year old gentleman. He lives with his family, which is comprised of his 44 year old wife, Gloria, and their daughters. Shirley is 22, and Gloria is 13. They live in a cozy house in a peaceful area to the south of the city of Lima. He works as a taxi driver. He has his own car, which he works in all day, every day, and without rest. He has been doing this for 15 years because it is very profitable for him. Also, his experience has made him know which areas he should head towards and what type of person he should pick up. He has chosen to work during the day because it is safer. Roger remembers his old job with nostalgia. He used to be a construction worker. After a time he was able to save money so that he could get a car. That is how he decided to be a taxi driver. Now he can work calmly and support his family without problems. This enthusiastic taxi driver’s goal is to have a fleet of taxis where he would be the proprietor and the administrator. But, he knows that in order to reach this goal he has to put forth great effort and work with determination. He has already started to plan for the future because he plans to refurbish his current vehicle. He will also associate himself with his brother-in-law in order to buy a new car; the two of them will rent out the car. Roger is a businessman. Therefore, he is very responsible with each one of his payments. He knows that even though this is his seventh loan with MFP, he needs to keep demonstrating responsibility. Also, he adds that he is punctual because the only people who triumph are this way. He plans to use the money he is asking for to refurbish his vehicle in order to be able to work peacefully and offer security to the different passengers that he transports day to day.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Refurbish his car

loans.name: Brigitte

texts.fr: Brigitte T. est une veuve de 57 ans, mère de 4 enfants. Elle vend de la boisson et souhaiterait améliorer son commerce. Son objectif est de soutenir ses enfants et d'améliorer leur condition de vie.
texts.en:
Brigitte T. is a widow, 57 years old, and the mother of four children. She sells beverages and would like to improve her business. Her objective is to support her children and to improve their living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell drinks

loans.name: Adebukola

texts.en: Adebukola sells crates of drinks at wholesale and retail prices to make a living. She is a focused, hard worker. She is 49 years old, a widow with 2 children. She takes care of the welfare of her children alone. She has been in this business for 3 years. She is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more drinks to sell. This is the high season for her business and she hopes to meet the demand of her customers. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Brian

texts.en: Brian definitely has an entrepreneurial streak - after converting a city bus to run on vegetable oil, he launched his own alternative fuel retail company at the tender age of 23, right after getting his engineering degree. Brian recognizes that alternative fuel methods, while in demand, are costly for the average consumer, and his idea was to sell affordable products to meet this demand. Brian started his business on Ebay (an online buying and selling organization), where it was very successful. In the summer of 2008, shortly after he began selling, world oil prices took off and Brian's business became wildly profitable. He now has three very busy employees and keeps costs down by ordering in bulk, so that he can keep shipping costs affordable for his customers. He's going to use this loan to purchase inventory so that he can stay ahead of the curve in meeting his customers’ demands - as he says, "if I run out, it's an emergency!" Aware of his participation in the "green" movement, Brian is convinced that renewable energy is "the fuel of the future" because "unlike everything else, it won't run out at some point." Though Brian wants to stay on the cutting edge in terms of designing innovative renewable energy products, he always keeps an eye towards his customers and makes sure to continue offering the products they want. Brian hopes that one day, he can run a biodiesel station on the highway that will be affordable enough to entice the average driver away from the gas station. About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA: Have you ever thought about how the cute new café on your corner or the salon you frequent every month got the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated ten million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis”. Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education. Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild our economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and provide employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: To increase his inventory of alternative fuel and chemicals

loans.name: Vero

texts.en: Vero sells garri (cassava flakes), wholesale and retail, to her customers at the village market.  She is a 46-year-old married woman with 5 children. She puts in long hours trying to keep her business sustainable. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. Vero is requesting a loan in the amount of 80,000 NGN to purchase garri (cassava flakes) to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more garri (cassava flakes) to sell

loans.name: Tim

texts.en:
Mrs. Tim S., 29, is a cake seller who, since early 2007, has been operating her business located in Kompong Tom province. She buys her ingredient on credit to make cakes and pays after she finishes selling. She is able to generate $2 each day to support the requirements of her family.

Another source of family income comes from her husband’s job. He is a carpenter and he is shown in the photo. Due to her husband needing supplies to perform his enterprise, Tim S. is applying for a loan to buy carpentry materials.

loans.use: To buy carpentry materials for her husband's business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria V. is a 37-year-old woman from the coastal town of Talim Island, Rizal Province, in the Philippines. She is the mother of a 4-year-old child, Ian Roy. She is married to a fisherman, Modesto, who is 40 years old.


In 2009, Victoria joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines. She was full of hopes of uplifting her family from the cycle of poverty. For her new loan, she is requesting 10,000 PHP as additional working capital for her fishing business. She uses fish cages to catch fish and then delivers the different kinds of fish to nearby towns, where it is purchased by customers.


Now that she has the chance to realize her dreams, she hopes to buy more fish cages to catch more fish to sell in the nearby village. Like most families here in the Philippines, they are dreaming for the best in life and also a happy family.

loans.use: to buy more fish cages.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a 53-year-old married man with nine children. Three of the children attend school.  He was formerly employed by the government of Kenya before he ventured into running a retail shop for a decade.  He is also a farmer. He is an active member of Faulu Kenya and has taken three loans of Kes. 60,000 in the past.  He has requested a loan of Kes. 60,000 to buy crates of soda, bales of maize and wheat flour, and bags of sugar.  He hopes to buy a tractor for farming and for hiring.  He sees himself expanding his business into wholesale.

loans.use: Add to his stock of soda, maize flour, wheat flour and sugar

loans.name: Join Hands Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Join Hands” group from the small town of Waterloo, near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. Kadiatu D., pictured in the middle, is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. The 49-year-old sells cigarettes, sweets, lollipops, cheese, milk, sugar, butter, etc. She has been a businesswoman since childhood days. She is seeking from Kiva lenders a loan of SLL 400,000 in order to buy the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to her current ones. 

Kadiatu D. was born in one of the several villages that make up the Sanda community, near Makeni, northern Sierra Leone. She now lives in Waterloo, where 'Shine on Sierra Leone' has partnered with SMT to start a branch, together with her husband and four children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending school – one in secondary school, two in primary school, and the other is not of school-going age.

loans.use: Buy cigarettes, sweets, lollipops, cheese, milk, sugar, butter, etc

loans.name: Kamu Kamu D Nakafuma Robinah Group

texts.en: N. Robinah is a wonderful business lady and the group representative. She is twenty-seven years old, a single lady with three children of whom two are going to school, and she has six dependents of whom two are going to school, too. She runs a business roasting chickens for sale. She has been doing this business for over eleven years. She is using the loan to add capital to her business by purchasing plenty of chickens to roast for her customers. She is a hard-working business lady whose dream is to prosper.

loans.use: To add capital to her business by purchasing plenty of chickens to roast

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan M. M. is 37 years old and married with one child who is in school. She runs a photograph studio to earn a living. She has been in this business for 10 years and has two employees.

Since Susan joined Faulu Kenya, she has acquired management skills from their training. She hopes to grow her business and double the business turnover in five years time.

She has requested a loan of 30000 KES from Faulu Kenya to buy a photocopy machine. She describes herself as hardworking and social.

loans.use: To  purchase a photocopy machine.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth T. sells seafood products, particularly fish and shrimp, in the local community. Maribeth has been engaged in her business for over 40 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from these activities. She is from the village of Dampil, Lagonglong, Misamis Oriental. She is 51 years old. She and her busband have seven adult-aged children.

In 2009, Maribeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Maribeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. Maribeth has decided to request a second loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
