HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To obtain additional seafood products to sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 23 year old man and a father of one. He has been working as a concrete carpenter for five years already. Today, Ali is requesting a loan to purchase wood for his business. This is the first time that he has requested a loan. His is planning to improve his work and expand his stock which he hopes will help him improve his financial situation. He is confident that this will help him get more projects.  

Ali is special in his work because he does it well and has good experience in this domain. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. When he first started his business, he had some financial issues. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work and because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase wood for his business.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas 1,2,3 Group

texts.en:
Paula is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres Unidas (United Women), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the lush, rugged Samana peninsula, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with long-term partner and their five children.

Paula is excited to be taking her 10th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling home appliances by purchasing sewing machines to sell. She will use the profits to invest in clothing and school supplies for her children. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy sewing machines

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda M. is a married woman who lives in Cogon III, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. She earns a living by operating a fish vending business.  Her husband Romeo, who is 60 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and also helps his wife's business activities. They have two children who are 35 and 37 years old. 

Erlinda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1997 because she aspired to have something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Erlinda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, lifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 18th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,500, which she intends to use to improve her business so that she can continue to save up for future house improvement. Erlinda M. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: For additional working capital.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofia tiene 23 años y tiene dos hijos. Yo vive en la comunidad campesina de Rayanniyoc de la distrito de Taray de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco.  

La mayoría de los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería, yo cuento con un pequeño negocio el cual consiste en vender ganado como por ejemplo vacas y toros y también me dedico a la crianza  de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y gallinas. Yo compro animales críos en la ferias agropecuarios de las ciudad Combapata y Inquilpata, después los alimento los hace engoradar para luego venderlos en las mismas ferias. Al principio se me hacia un poco difícil ya que no contaba con mucho capital, fue entonces que se me presento la oportunidad de pertenecer al banco comunal de Arariwa, el cual nos brindo apoyo con préstamos de dinero y así pudimos muchos de nosotros empezar y así mejorar nuestros negocios. Ya son varios años que participo en el banco comunal “Villa Rayanniyoc” y mis compañeras confían en mi responsabilidad y puntualidad de mis pagos por ese motivo requiero el crédito para aumentar el capital de mi negocio y deseo comprar más animales críos.
texts.en:
Sofia is 23 years old, and she has two children. She lives in the Rayanniyoc rural community in the Taray district, Calca province, Cusco department. Most of the inhabitants work in agriculture and livestock. She has a small business, which consists of selling livestock like cows and bull. She also raises small animals like guinea pigs and hens. She buys the baby animals in the agricultural fairs in the cities of Combapata and Inquilpata. Then, she feeds them to fatten them in order to later sell them at the same fairs. In the beginning, it was a little difficult for her because she did not have much capital. Then the opportunity presented itself to belong to the Arariwa communal bank. It offered support with loans, and many of the members could start and improve their businesses. She has participated in the Villa Rayanniyoc Communal Bank for several years. Her colleagues have faith in her responsibility and the punctuality of her payments. She needs a loan to increase the capital in her business. She wishes to buy more baby animals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy baby animals

loans.name: Kosol

texts.en: Mrs. Kosol T. was born in 1987, lives in Roluos village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns two-hectare plot of land where she is able growing rice to sell to support her family. Now she has some problem because her field is far away from irrigation system. So to improve her face problem, Mrs. Kosol T. is requesting for a loan to buy a pump machine and rest of the loan she buys gasoline, fertilizer, and pesticide. Her husband, Mr. Seyha Toem, is a fisherman and he is also a laborer who can earn a little income to support his family. Through this activity, they support two children whom all are too small to work or study. Her husband is taken the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy a pump machine

loans.name: Nyarutojo Tukwatanise, Kihihi Group

texts.en:
Through hustling and toiling, one hard working Ellias T., aged 40, managed to invest in the timber sector for over 5 years now, after exploring the potential from his own planted trees. He was driven into this business by the fact there is a lot demand in the prevailing market from Nyarutojo Trading centre where he does his business. He does this with the support of his spouse, along with their milk sales business, and they earn a good profit in Ugandan shillings.

With a lot of work requiring timber as a raw material, including furniture workshops, building and construction, Ellias hopes to expand his business by getting this loan and opening up supply stores and buying more timber for sale. This will enable him to earn more revenue and be able to maintain a self-sustaining life and meet his lifelong dream of educating his children.

loans.use: To purchase more timber for resale.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita B. is from the village of Poblacion, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 33 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Pacita sells scrap metal and other used products like "grabas" in her community. Pacita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2010, Pacita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services with the hopes of improving her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pacita is requesting her first loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional items to sell. She plans to use any additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase scrap metal and other used items for resale.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira G. is from the village of Barangay 1, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 53 years old. Elvira is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Elvira owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Elvira has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elvira joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Elvira is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Elvira from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Mery

texts.es: Mery tiene 47 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo en su casa propia. Desde hace un año posee una tienda de abarrotes, ubicada en su misma casa. Atendiendo durante las tardes, puesto que es profesora y durante las mañanas trabaja en un centro educativo, por ello se vio en la necesidad de contratar a una persona para que le ayude en la atención durante las horas que esta ausente. Le agrada su negocio porque le permite tener las entradas económicas que necesita para complementar con el sueldo que recibe cada mes, y con ello poder asumir los gastos que tiene dentro de su familia. En el futuro desea tener una tienda más grande y más repleta de mercadería. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería en abarrotes y menestras.
texts.en:
Mery is 47 and lives with her husband and son in their own house. For a year she has had a grocery store, which is located in the house. She tends it during the afternoons, since she is a teacher and works at an educational center in the mornings. That is why she found it necessary to hire someone to help her watch the store in the times she is not there. She is grateful for her business because it permits her to have the income she needs to complement the salary she receives every month, and with it she can cover her family's expenses. In the future she would like to have a larger store with more merchandise. This is Mery's first loan with MFP. She is very happy to know she has financial support. She is also grateful to be part of her communal bank because all its members are responsible people and are a very close-knit group. She would like to thank all the people who have made this loan possible, as it will be very useful to her in her business' growth. With the loan she is requesting, she will purchase merchandise for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase staple items to stock her store

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac, en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio  es el Sr. Roberto; El socio tiene 75 años de edad;  él es casado y tiene 8 hijos; el socio se dedica a la artesanía, el es artesano desde hace 28 años ahora el socio tiene su propio stand en el centro artesanal, el mismo ha aprendido a elaborar artesanía y la produce y vende. El socio requiere un capital de trabajo para comprar materiales para la elaboración de la artesanía. El socio solicita el préstamo para  comprar materiales como arcilla, pigmentos, para elaborar la artesanía.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Introducing Roberto, a member of the Banco Comunal “Caminemos Juntas” (Let’s Walk Together Communal Bank), located in the Huanchac, in the province and department of Cusco.

Roberto is 75 years old, he is married and has 8 children. He has been an artisan for 28 years, engaging in handicrafts. He now has his own stand in a crafts center; as he has learnt to create handicraft by himself, he produces and sells it. He needs working funds to buy materials to create handicrafts. He is requesting a loan to buy materials such as clay and pigments to create handicrafts.

He is thankful to and appreciates this loan-granting mean, and at the same time he commits to comply with repaying his dues at the set deadlines.

loans.use: To buy clay and pigments to produce handicrafts.

loans.name: Ngen

texts.en: Ngen V., 35, is married and lives with her husband in Takeo province. She is a farmer who works for less than US$1 each day, while her husband is a cow dealer. On average, he makes US$3.50 of profit a day. This couple has three children, who still live at home. Ngen V. would like to take out a loan of US$1200 to purchase cows.

loans.use: To purchase cows.

loans.name: Cecelia Aba Nyarkoa

texts.en: Cecelia Aba Nyarkoa E. is divorced and has three children. She has received senior high education. Cecelia is a hairdresser at Asenadze near Abura. She has been in this trade for fifteen years. Cecelia uses the income she makes to take care of her children.  The loan will enable her to purchase more hair products to use on customers' hair. With the new profits from her expanded business, Cecelia plans to buy an additional hair dryer.

loans.use: purchase more hair products

loans.name: Dzende

texts.en:
Dzende is a married woman with one child who graduated from school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She has been selling food from home for over seven years to her neighbours and passers-by. Previously, selling charcoal contributed to her other source of income.  Dzende faces a major challenge of thieves in her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, wheat flour and cooking oil for her food stall business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase maize flour, wheat flour, cooking oil

loans.name: Jane Wanjiru

texts.en:
Jane is 44 years old. She has been selling fruits and vegetables in Naivasha town for the last three years. She mainly walks round town supplying her produce to different customers.
She was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by her friend and this will be her second loan. She paid back her first loan well and in good time. She plans to use this loan to buy more fruits and vegetables for resale.
In the future, Jane hopes she will be supplying foodstuffs to different institutions in bulk.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a single woman with two children, both of whom have graduated from school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Margaret operates a second-hand business, selling clothes, hand bags and shoes in a shop to her neighbors and passersby. She has been in business for nine years, but seasonality is a major challenge. Demand is high during the holiday season, but low during the other months.  

Margaret decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business. With this KES 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase more clothes, materials, handbags and shoes for sale. She hopes to establish another boutique in the future.

loans.use: to purchase clothes, materials, handbags and shoes for sale

loans.name: Mauro Nicolás

texts.es:
Mauro Nicolás C. S. tiene 26 años de edad, Vive en Unión Libre, vive con la esposa y con los hijos,  vive en el Cantón de Ventanas  Provincia los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JACINTO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto campo alegre, por la parroquia guare perteneciente al cantón baba, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.  Esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Mauro Nicolás se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en el Comercial Cepeda y Comercial Chicaisa y vende los  productos en el Comercial López.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un terreno y hacer una casa..

Le gusta jugar villa.
texts.en: Mauro Nicolás C. S. is 26 and in a common-law marriage. He lives with his wife and children in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios Province. He has 3 children. The  V.R.C. SAN JACINTO is located in the Campo Alegre area, in the Guare Parish belonging to the Baba Canton. This area is dedicated to short-cycle agricultural labour; the sowing of corn and rice. They spend a lot of time doing this work. Mauro Nicolás works in agriculture, sowing corn and rice. He purchases his products in the Cepeda and Chicaisa Markets and sells them in the Lopez Market. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of agricultural inputs and fertilizers for the cultivation of corn and rice. The support of this loan will help him economically to supply his needs. He confronts challenges such as plagues and diseases and the varied climate. His dream is to purchase a plot of land and build a house. He enjoys playing Villa.

loans.use: agricultural inputs and fertilizers

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 32 years old and married with two children aged 4 and 7. He owns a home in Hoima, Uganda. His family goal is to educate his children up to university. 

He runs a business selling second-hand shoes and has been running it for 14 years amid the challenge of seasonal customers. His business goal is to relocate to a bigger shop in town. Vincent needs the loan to buy shoes to sell.

loans.use: To purchase used shoes

loans.name: Ely

texts.en:
Ely A. is from the village of Dapacan Alto, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old, married and has 3 adult-aged children. Ely owns and operates a business making and selling food such as breads, cakes and cookies, to the local community. Ely is just starting this business.

In 2009, Ely joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ely has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC, which was used for additional inventory and working capital. Ely is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the third loan taken out by Ely from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients

loans.name: Rosa Alicia

texts.es:
Rosa  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Túpac Amaru”, ubicado en el distrito de Yunguyo, provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 26 años de edad,  es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo.  Rosa pudo estudiar la secundaria pero no culminarla. 
Viaja semanalmente a la ciudad de La Paz – Bolivia llevando diferentes tipos de producto, que a continuación se detallan: tunta (papa procesada), chuño (papa procesada), frazadas y otras veces pescado; las frazadas las encarga comprar en Juliaca y el resto del los productos lo compra en desaguadero. Hace un año viene trabajando  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos.  Su préstamo inicial fue de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en la compra de cinco arrobas de chuño blanco.
Con éste  préstamo de S/ 1,500.00 nuevo soles, comprará cuatro quintales de tunta y así seguir creciendo en su negocio.
 Su sueño es mejorar cada vez más y más en su negocio.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la capacitación y la ganancia del ahorro.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the “Túpac Amaru” communal bank located in Yunguyo district, Yunguyo province, Puno department.  She is 26 years old, lives with partner and has a son.  Rosa was able to start middle school but did not finish it.

She travels weekly to La Paz, Bolivia to take a variety of products listed below: tunta (processed potato), chuño, (processed potato), blankets and sometimes fish.  She buys the blankets in Juliaca and the rest of the products in Desaguadero.  

She’s been collaborating with Manuela Ramos Movement for a year.  Her initial loan was for 500 new soles that she used to buy five arrobas (1 arroba=11.5 kilos) of white chuño.  She will use this 1500 new sol loan to buy four quintals of tunta to continue growing with her business.

Her dream is to improve her business more and more each time.  What she likes about the communal bank is the training and the profits on savings.

loans.use: To buy four quintals of dehydrated, frozen potato.

loans.name: Cleto

texts.en:
Cleto Y. is from the village of Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 24 years old. Cleto is single. 

To make a living, Cleto owns and operates a jeepney (small bus) transport service. Cleto has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Cleto joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Cleto is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to repair his vehicle for better service. This will be the first loan taken out by Cleto from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair his vehicle for better service

loans.name: Beberly

texts.en:
Beberly A. is from the village of Simanoc, Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 43 years old. Beberly is married and has three school-aged children. 

To make a living, Beberly sells ready-to-wear clothing like blouses and  t-shirts as well as blankets. Beberly has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Beberly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Beberly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Beberly is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like t-shirts and blouses. This will be the third loan taken out by Beberly from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like t-shirts and blouses

loans.name: Michael Mutisya

texts.en:
Michael is married and has one child. His primary business is a barber shop and he has been in the barber shop business for 11 years. The barber shop brings in an income of Kshs 10,000 a month. His barber shop is in the market and has day to day customers who frequent the market.

Michael joined KADET through existing clients and is on his second loan after he repaid his previous loan successfully. He is requesting a loan of Kshs 30,000 which he shall use to purchase barber shop items like mirrors, a shaving machine and cream and towels so as to standardize his barber shop to attract more customers. With the extra profits, Michael shall invest and become financially stable.

Michael describes himself as hardworking.

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur REVIEW MICHAEL from  Kenya

loans.use: To buy barber shop items

loans.name: Vich

texts.en:
Vich V., age 37, is a farmer residing in the rural area of Kompong Tom province. She keeps pigs in a pigpen behind her house. Every four months, she sells these to a slaughterer. In addition to this cyclical income, she has an annual business of planting and harvesting rice crops. Her husband works in construction. They have five children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory as sewing workers.

Sot Vanny is looking for a loan to use as capital to support her farming business. She will use the loan to buy additional piglets and to buy cashews to offer for sale in order to gain additional income and profit.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and to buy cashews to offer for sale

loans.name: Sot

texts.en: Sot S. is 53 years old and resides in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for itsf Pre-Angkorean temples. S. sells vegetables and meat, earning an income of $2.60 per day. Her husband is a traditional musician, earning an income of $2.30 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $83 on food and $90 on other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan for $1,000 to purchase more meat and vegetables to expand her current business. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to purchase more meat and vegetables

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba S. is into the production and sale of kenkey at Amoanda near Elmina. (Kenkey is fermented corn dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves.) She is a divorcee taking care of six dependents. Even though she is separated from her husband, her husband contributes to the education of her children. Her loan will be used to buy more maize to prepare the kenkey for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards the university education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more maize to prepare the kenkey she sells.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco es un cliente de 31  años de edad, vive  junto a su esposa  e hijos en el distrito de Túcume- Lambayeque, en  una comunidad pequeña y rural de gente trabajadora y emprendedora.

Francisco  es un hombre trabajador que lucha por el bienestar de su familia, es por eso que se dedica a dos actividades. Francisco prepara pan y dulces que luego comercializa a los pobladores de su comunidad y también brinda el servicio de mototaxi (moto con cabina en la parte posterior para transporte de pasajeros). En muchas ocasiones utiliza su moto para llevar el pan y los dulces a casa de sus clientes.

Francisco cuenta con una clientela fija debido a la buena calidad de sus productos y servicios. Además, los pobladores de la zona lo estiman mucho. 

Él solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2500 nuevos soles que invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para sus panes, como harina y manteca y para  hacerle mejoras a su mototaxi lo que le permitirá seguir desarrollando sus actividades adecuadamente.

Francisco tiene muchos deseos de superación y su esposa lo apoya en todas las actividades que este realiza, existe una gran unión familiar.
texts.en:
Francisco es un cliente de 31  años de edad, vive  junto a su esposa  e hijos en el distrito de Túcume- Lambayeque, en  una comunidad pequeña y rural de gente trabajadora y emprendedora.

Francisco  es un hombre trabajador que lucha por el bienestar de su familia, es por eso que se dedica a dos actividades. Francisco prepara pan y dulces que luego comercializa a los pobladores de su comunidad y también brinda el servicio de mototaxi (moto con cabina en la parte posterior para transporte de pasajeros). En muchas ocasiones utiliza su moto para llevar el pan y los dulces a casa de sus clientes.

Francisco cuenta con una clientela fija debido a la buena calidad de sus productos y servicios. Además, los pobladores de la zona lo estiman mucho. 

Él solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2500 nuevos soles que invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para sus panes, como harina y manteca y para  hacerle mejoras a su mototaxi lo que le permitirá seguir desarrollando sus actividades adecuadamente.

Francisco tiene muchos deseos de superación y su esposa lo apoya en todas las actividades que este realiza, existe una gran unión familiar.

loans.use: Comprar ingredientes para panes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to look after his cows and invest in his milk business

loans.name: Ritah's Group

texts.en:
Ritah is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Ritah has a business selling food like matooke (steamed plantain), which she has run two years.
To help expand her business, Ritah has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Ritah hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself and for her young brother. In the future, she hopes to open up a hardware shop.
Ritah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her improve her business, which has, in turn, helped her pay her school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more food for resale.

loans.name: Paulino José

texts.es:
Paulino José trabaja en la ciudad de Managua como tornero industrial.
Es padre de familia de un hijo y este se encuentra en edad escolar.
El acude a las oficinas para solicitar un préstamo para el mejoramiento de su vivienda, el va utilizar el dinero para la compra de materiales de construcción, para continuar el procesa progresivo del mejoramiento de su vivienda.
A gradece a ceprodel por brindarle la oportunidad  de tener una vivienda digna para sus familia.
texts.en:
Paulino José works in the city of Managua as an industrial lathe operator. He is the father of a child who is in school. Paulino came to the offices of CEPRODEL to request a home improvement loan. He plans to use the money to buy construction materials so that he can continue the process of making gradual improvements to his home.

He is grateful to CEPRODEL for providing the opportunity for his family to have a decent home.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for home improvements.

loans.name: Phelista

texts.en:
Phelista is a resident of Kitale, Western Kenya and fully relies on her farming. She has been farming for the last 20 years as her only source of liivelihood. Her farm produces milk, maize, beans and vegetables. She is married with three adult children.

Phelista has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says this will increase her milk production and boost her income tremendously, thereby enabling her to expand her business.

Phelista says the high costs for animal feed and management of disease remain the major challenges. She is pleased with Juhudi's interventions for farmers.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Hilda Rose

texts.en:
Hilda Rose is married and works hard to support her family.  She has an abaca making business in the Philippines.

Hilda Rose requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her business.  She has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Hilda Rose would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her abaca business

loans.name: Madina

texts.en: Madina lives in Uganda. She is married and has 5 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (elderly parents).  Madina sells bananas. She has been in this business for 6 years and she works 7 days a week. Madina sells her products retail from home. She has requested a loan of 500000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO which she will use to buy bunches of bananas. The main business challenges for Madina include the rainy season which makes rural roads impassable and transportation. Her goals for her business are to own a delivery van, to start selling wholesale only and also to buy a plot of land. Madina lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 23-year-old married woman.

She has been in the clothing business for the past two years, and from it, she gets a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

She has been loaned KES 30,000 from KADET Ltd. This is her first loan, and she intends to use her loan to purchase more stock of clothes for resale.

With the anticipated profit, she wishes to continue running her business as well as continue saving a portion of it so that she can run her own boutique in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Avaroa Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AVAROA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Senkata, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Gillermina. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejido de chompas, tienda de barrio, venta de comida, venta de papa y crianza de ganado.

La señora Gillermina  indica que este es el primer ciclo que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de crianza de ganado que viene trabajando hace años atrás, aprendo este oficio de su mamá. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra alimento para su ganado) que comprará de la Ceja y posteriormente lo repartirá a su ganado. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia pues ella es casada  y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el consultorio.
texts.en:
The civil association AVAROA is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer; as part of the Centro Senkata, the group is made up of seven members and is directed by a directive board, headed by Gillermina.  The members of the association work in several different sectors, including: textiles, convenience stores, food sales, potato sales, and livestock.

According to Gillermina, this is the first cycle for which the group is working with Pro Mujer, entering into the partnership by invitation of a promoter. Gillermina currently has a livestock-raising business in which she has worked for several years, taking over the business from her mother.


The loan that Gillermina is applying for is to increase her capital by purchasing feed for her livestock. She will buy the feed in Ceja, and then give it to her animals. This type of work will help her generate the resources to support her family, which includes her husband and their three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the consultancy.

loans.use: to buy feed for livestock.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben is a 40-year-old married man with a 7-year-old child. 

He is a farmer working in Surallah, South Cotabato. Ruben plants rice on his land and sells his harvest to traders in his town.  Ruben also raises pigs in his backyard.

Ruben has requested a loan to purchase feed, fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs.  He hopes to have a stable income to sustain his family and his child's education.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Chantale

texts.fr:
Cliente de 44 ans,celibataire avec 6 enfants ,  ayant déjà bénéficié de 3 cycles de prêts a Hope, elle a rembourse avec succès et a des épargnes considérables, ses ventes ont largement augmentes de 25000 fr a 150.000fr par jour.

A l'octroi de son quatrième prêt , elle va renforcer son stock de cartons de poissons sales en achetant 15 cartons de morues, 20 cartons de soles,15 cartons de requins, 15 cartons de thons.

Elle tient a tout prix a atteindre ses objectifs, celui d'ouvrir un dépôt de poisson sale dans peu de temps et importer les cartons de poissons de l'étranger pour être grossiste.
Avec ses bénéfices elle continue a épargner et prend soi de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This client is 44 years old and single with six children. She has already received three loans from Hope, which she reimbursed successfully. She has put aside considerable savings. Her sales have gone up a lot from 25,000 to 150,000 francs per day. 

On receiving her fourth loan, she is going to add to her stock of salted fish by buying 15 cartons of cod, 20 cartons of sole, 15 cartons of shark, and 15 cartons of tuna. 

She is absolutely intent on attaining her objectives: opening a salted fish depot in a short time and importing cartons of fish from overseas in order to be a wholesaler. 

With her profit, she continues to save and to care for her children.

loans.use: to buy 65 boxes of different types of salted fish, such as cod, sole and tuna.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 24-year-old married woman with three children, all three of whom are in school. She has a business of selling beans and rice in Yei county, South Sudan. She has been in this business for five years.
Mary requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to purchase more beans and rice for sale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more beans and rice for sale.

loans.name: Albertina

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, tem 38 anos de idade, solteira mãe de 3 filhos todos vão a Escola. Vive na casa própria e responsabiliza se pelas suas 2 sobrinhas que vivem com ela na sua casa. Consegue poupar 1.000.00mt na sua conta bancaria.


Nunca saiu do Distrito, iniciou a sua actividade comercial muito jovem. É comerciante ha mais de 20 anos, vende diversos tipos de roupa, com os lucros consegue iniciar sua obra que devido ao elevado custo do material não consegue concluir , solicita um empréstimo na Hluvuku para dar continuidade da mesma.  

Este é seu quarto empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção da sua casa( cimento, arreia, blocos e mais). Os anteriores de (3.000.00, 5.000.00 e 7.000.00)mt foram para o comercio. Está disposta a pagar com sucesso para aderir mais empréstimos.
texts.en:
She was born in the district of Nammacha. She is 38 years old, single and the mother of three children, all of which attend school. She lives in a house she owns and is also responsible for her two nieces who live with her. She is able to save 1.000mt in her bank account.
She has never left the district and started her retail business at a very young age. She has been in sales for over 20 years and sells various kinds of clothing. With her profits she was able to begin her construction project, but couldn't finish it due to the high cost of supplies. She requests a loan from Hluvuku so that she can keep building.
This is her fourth loan with Hluvuku. It is for 10.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase construction supplies for her house (cement, sand, cinder blocks, etc.). The first loans were for 3.000mt, 5.000mt and 7.000mt, for her retail business. She is willing to successfully make the repayments in order to obtain more loans.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies for her house (cement, sand, cinder blocks, etc.).

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria is a mother of seven children. She is married and lives in Bintangan, Larena, Siquijor.

Candelaria is a farmer and is engaged in growing pigs to earn a living.  She has been doing this for two years.  She has requested a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to buy feed and medicines for her piggery business.

Candelaria has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for one year.  In the future, Candelaria hopes to expand her business and have a savings deposit out of the profit from her business.

loans.use: To buy feed and medicines for her piggery business.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia, de 48 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y muy empeñosa, además de ser alegre y extrovertida, es conviviente con Víctor, vive en compañía de su pareja, su hijo de 15 años de edad y su sobrino, al cual están apoyando con sus estudios, estando instalados todos en una casa que es su propiedad. La actividad que realiza Lucia, es la venta de ropa importada de segundo uso, que lo adquiere en la ciudad de Pucallpa en un centro comercial, donde encuentra la mayor variedad de prendas y a mejores precios. Dicha mercadería es vendida en las zonas alejadas, y en otros poblados. Tiene 6 años realizando esta actividad, siendo muy conocida en su trabajo. 
Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el poder realizar viajes cortos y conocer nuevos lugares y más personas, así como estar en actividad y sentirse una mujer productiva. Su plan es cambiar de negocio y abrir una bodega en su casa o un restaurante. Este será el préstamo número 10 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida por la oportunidad de contar con una línea de crédito, por eso se compromete en ser puntal con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado, comprará ropa importada, de diferentes variedades y modelos, en mayor cantidad y a menor   precio, para mejorar sus márgenes de ganancias.
texts.en:
Lucia, 48, is a hardworking, dedicated woman besides being cheerful and extroverted.  She lives with Victor, her spouse, and her 15-year-old son and a nephew who she’s helping with his schooling; they all live together in a house she owns.

Lucia sells imported second-hand clothing that she gets in a shopping center in the city of Pucallpa where a wider variety of clothes and at better prices are found.  Said merchandise is then sold in distant zones and in other towns.  She’s been doing this for six years and is very well known in her work.   What she enjoys about the work is being able to take short trips and getting to know other places and people as well as being active and feeling productive.  Her plan is to change her business and open a store or a restaurant at home.

This will be MFP loan #10.  She feels grateful for the opportunity of having a line of credit so she commits to be punctual with her installment payments.  She will use the requested amount to buy assorted imported clothes in various styles and in larger amounts at a lower price to improve her profit margin.

loans.use: to buy imported second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Mama Safi Group

texts.en:
Beatrice takes care of eight children at home.  In the recent 2011 season, she had a very good maize yield harvesting 23 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, she was only able to harvest 5 ½ bags of maize on one acre of land. She joined One Acre Fund because of One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for her family and later educate them. With income from maize sales, Beatrice will educate her children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing. 

Beatrice is the facilitator of the Mama Safi group. Beatrice and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Mama Safi group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Beatrice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ayen

texts.en:
Ayen is 38 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school.  For three years, she has run a business selling food items in Bor, South Sudan.

Ayen has requested a loan through BRAC South Sudan in order to purchase beans to sell.  She will use the extra income generated from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase beans to sell.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Ms Mai is 41 years old with two childen who are school age. She has run a small grocery shop for ten years. In 2007, she became a client of the SEDA credit program. All of her previous loans were to invest in developing her shop. Currently, she wants to borrow 9,632,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) to buy more new products to meet the demand of customers on the Tet holiday.

loans.use: to buy more new products to meet the demand of customers on the Tet holiday.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 30 years old and married with a 7-year-old child. For the past two years, she has sold blouses, skirts, and shoes to earn a living and she has employed one person. She is able to earn extra income from her employment and has been able to expand her business since she joined Faulu Kenya. 

Ruth is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy clothes and shoes. In the future, she hopes to continue to expand her business and become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes

loans.name: Ndeye's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 24 femmes fait parti du banc villageois qui a été crée le 12 décembre 2009. Il regroupe des femmes qui habitent dans le même village et ceux des alentours. Elles vivent une parfaite solidarité entre elles. 
Dibe âgée de 55 ans est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Sur la photo elle est en position debout et a levé la main.
Avec le prêt elle va acheter 2 moutons à 30000f l'un et va assurer les frais vétérinaires et l’aliment de bétail qui lui revient à 67500f, les frais de convoyage des bêtes 2000f. Elle va les engraisser pour une durée de 5 mois.
Les bénéfices lui permettent d'épargner pour acheter un terrain, un projet qu'elle rêve de réaliser un jour.
texts.en:
This group of 24 women is part of the"banc villageois" that was founded on 12 December 2009. The group includes women who live in the same village and neighbouring villages. They all live in perfect solidarity.
Dibe is 55 years old- She is married and has two children. In the photo she is standing up with her hand raised.
She will use the loan to buy two sheep that cost 30,000 CFA each and she will cover the veterinary costs and livestock feed costs that come to 67,500 CFA, plus the transportation costs of the livestock for 2,000 CFA. She will fatten the sheep for a period of 5 months.
The profits will enable her to save so that she can buy a plot of land, a project that she dreams of being able to realize one day.

loans.use: To buy sheep

loans.name: Sahobidin

texts.ru: На фотографии запечатлено Сахобидин. Ему 29 лет. Он живет вместе с матерью и женой. Сахобидин пока не имеет детей. Он один сын в семье. Его отец раньше занимался торговлей деятельности. После его смерти Сахобидин старается открыть совой бизнес, зарабатывать и оьечпечить семью. Он хочет заниматься торговлей деятельности, и перевозит сухофрукты. Для старат нового бизнеса ему нужна поддержка. И по этой причине Саходидин обратился к Вам за кредитом. Он надеется на Вашу поддержку. Вы можете помочь Саходидину иметь постоянную работу.

loans.use: Для перевоза суха фрукты и открытия нового бизнеса.

loans.name: Eloy Tomas

texts.en:
Eloy is working in the production and sale of Donuts, he learned how to cook them since 20 years ago in a bakery where he worked, however he lost his job, for that reason he decided to start his own business. At the moment he distributes his Donuts on the streets and he works alone. Eloy has 3 young children in his family; his wife is a housewife, so Eloy has a commitment to offer his children an education and a better quality of life. He is a very responsible, honest and working person, and every day Eloy puts all his effort to continue working and cover all the necessities from his beautiful family.

Eloy needs a loan of $200 USD to purchase raw material to the production of his delicious Donuts, he comments that this season is the beast to sale his products, so he wants to have a bigger production capacity. The form that he is going to use the loan is buying oil, flour, sugar, etc. In a term of 3-6 months Eloy plans to return this loan.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Eloy se dedica a la producción y venta de donas, aprendió a cocinarlas hace 20 años en una panadería donde el trabajaba, sin embargo se quedo sin empleo, por lo que decidió emprender su propio negocio. Actualmente distribuye sus donas por las calles y trabaja solo. Tiene 3 jóvenes niños en su familia, su esposa es ama de casa, por lo que para Eloy es un compromiso ofrecer a sus hijos una educación y una mejor calidad de vida. El es una persona muy responsable, honesta y trabajadora por lo que todos los días Eloy pone todo su esfuerzo para seguir trabajando y cubrir las necesidades de su hermosa familia.

Eloy necesita de $200 USD para comprar materia prima para la producción de sus ricas donas, comenta que estas temporadas son las más fuertes de todo el año en venta de su producto, por lo que desea tener una mayor capacidad de producción. La forma como utilizara el préstamo será comprando aceite, harina, azúcar, etc. En un término de 3-6 meses Eloy planea regresar el préstamo

loans.use: Purchase raw materia

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en: Sakina lives in Vingunguti area of Dar es Salaam.She owns a vegetable and fruits stall where she sells different fruits and vegetables.She fetch some of the fresh produce like tomatoes and spinaches from local farmers nearby her residence. She want to increase the quantity of the stock to overcome shortages .She is also planning to have cages for products attractive display and hygiene. This will make her products offering more attractive and therefore increase sales. To fulfill these requirements she is in need of USD 400 to subsidize her capital

loans.use: Improve business

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses J. is a retailer of bakery products in Kisumu. Moses is married with 4 children. He has repaid his first loan of 25 USD and would like to apply for a second loan of 170 USD, which he will use to buy a microwave and more electric appliances. His clients would like to be served warm and heated products, and with his loan, Moses will be able to do so. He will attract more customers and also increase his income so that he can feed his children and ensure that they remain in school.

loans.use: To purchase a microwave oven.

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.en:
Mrs. Tran Thi K. C. is 31 years old. She has a sweet home with a husband aged 34 and two lovely children aged 7 and 5. They live in Soc Son district, Hanoi capital. Her husband is an employee at Noi Bai airport, and she has a shop on her parents' land where she sells shoes and clothes while she looks after her smaller child. She has made clothes since she graduated from high school at the age of 18.

Thanks to her pleasant manner and professional skill, she receives many clients everyday. That is why this year she hired 3 people to make clothes with her. With a profit of $12-$24 per day from the shop, she and 3 employees can support themselves in this semi-urban area. However, she thinks that it is better to expand this business and create jobs for other neighbors, so she wants to borrow $1,200.00 to invest $430 on buying cloth and $770 on shoes. In addition, she wants to prove that a woman can succeed even though she doesn't have a chance to go to university.

loans.use: She wants to buy cloth and shoes for her tailoring and shoe shop.

loans.name: Fausto Antonio

texts.es:
"The condition of my house's roof is now very insecure due to the humidity that is in all our walls, which is also causing ilnesses in my family." I am requesting $1200 to waterproof the roof of my home.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

“Las condiciones en las que esta el techo de mi casa ya son muy inseguras ya que la humedad esta por todas la paredes y provoca enfermedades para mi familia”. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para impermeabilizar el techo de mi casa.

loans.use: Waterproof house's roof

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana Lucia D. is 50 years old and has 3 children. Two of her children are currently in grade school and one is in high school. Juana creates and sells cleaning supplies such as detergents, air fresheners, fabric softeners and soaps. Her products come in an array of aromas and sizes. She also buys powdered and liquid bleach in bulk to sell to different businesses.

Juana is requesting a loan of $1,025 to invest in containers of varying sizes so that she can make and store a greater quantity of cleaning supplies. She is a trustworthy and honest vendor of cleaning supplies who is well liked by her clients.

loans.use: To purchase containers of various sizes in which to store her products

loans.name: Tohirjon

texts.en: Tohirjon A. has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2002. He has an expanding business selling shoes in the J.Rasulov district. He requests a loan of $875 to increase the quantity and variety of his shoe stock.

loans.use: Increase the assortment of shoe stock

loans.name: Angella Apolot's Group

texts.en: Angella is a hair dresser. She intends to use the extra profits to open up a new salon and also purchase more salon equipment.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria J. S., age 32, is married with 1 child (15 years old). Maria owns a small café, which she started a year ago. Working from 7am-6pm daily, she earns about $35 a month from this business.

Maria now hopes for a loan to buy more food stock. Maria belongs to the loan group called Tuinuane, whose members ensure that all pay back their loans.

loans.use: To buy food stock (inventory) for her cafe

loans.name: Kiyinki B1 South D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Kageya Z.. She is currently in the business of running a restaurant and is requesting a loan to modernize and expand the business. Kageya is 39 years old and is married. She has 6 children ranging from age 2 to 18 and her children go to school. Each week, Kageya makes approximately UGX 6000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to re-invest in her business.

Kageya is joined in her small group by Amina N., Shadiya N., Fatuma N., and Minina N.. Amina N. has a business selling rice and wants to boost business. Shadiya N. is currently operating a business selling fuel and wants a loan to add to her business. Fatuma N. operates a business selling matooke and wants to start a business selling vegetables. Minina N. is currently in the business of making and selling snacks and is requesting a loan to purchase more ingredients and frying pans.

loans.use: To add capital to restaurant business and offer more quality services

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua F. is a fishmonger. She buys fish, smokes them, and then sells them. She is a single parent with five children. She is supporting her family with her small income. She wants to increase sales so she can increase her income.

Ekua F. is asking for a loan of $325 to buy more fish for processing and selling.

loans.use: To buy more fish for processing and selling

loans.name: Maria Ercilia

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria Ercilia B. P. is a member of the Communal Bank “Ayaymaman” and lives in the San Martín region of Moyobamba province in Moyobanba state. Her stand is located in the Ayaymaman market, where she sells groceries, vegetables, and other daily staples.

Upon finding herself a widow and seeing the necessity of supporting her children by herself, she found the possibility of a loan from the communal bank so she began selling bread products.

With a loan of S/1000.00 which will be repaid in 6 payments, she will buy: a variety of packaged noodles, crates of preserved fish, sacks of rice and sugar, liters of oil, and stock up on personal care products and products for the home.

She is 74 years old and lives with one of her daughters and grandchildren. She plans to keep working and have happy golden years.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Maria Ercilia B. P., es socia del Banco Comunal “Ayaymaman” vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de Moyobamba y distrito de Moyobamba, su puesto de ventas está ubicado en el mercado “Ayaymaman” en el vende abarrotes en general, verduras y otros productos comestibles de consumo diario.

Al quedarse viuda y viendo la necesidad de mantener sola a sus hijos y teniendo la posibilidad de un crédito en el banco comunal se inicia en la venta de productos de pan llevar.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1000.00 para pagar en 6 cuotas, comprará: fideos en paquetes de distintas variedades, conservas de pescado en cajas, arroz y azúcar en sacos en sacos, aceite en litros, además de surtir productos de aseo para el hogar y personal.

Actualmente tiene 74 años vive junto a una de sus hijas y sus nietos, anhela seguir trabajando y tener una feliz vejes.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy more merchandise to sell

loans.name: El Arroyo Unidad Group

texts.en:
Martina E. H. is a middle-aged woman that lives in Samaná, Dominican Republic. As a single mother, her small vending business allows her to support her two sons. With this particular loan, she is looking forward to the possibility of acquiring more inventory such as necklaces, purses, and jewelry. The earnings from her business will allow her to continue to support her children and put her one step closer to her dream, which is to return to school and earn a degree.

Martina (pictured in the center with the brown shirt) is just one member of the 10 person bank, El Arroyo Unido. Together, these Dominican entrepreneurs are able unite in solidarity, allowing them access to funding that they would otherwise never be able to receive on their own. The concept of this group bank paying their loan together is to reduce the risk of one person defaulting, as the other members gladly help cover one another’s payments in order to receive their next loan together.

On behalf of Martina E. and the entire team at Esperanza, we thank you for your support and awareness of the global issue of poverty that you are making a difference in.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of jewelry, key chains, purses, and other small items

loans.name: Meris

texts.es:
Mrs. Meris C., with much effort, works in the town of El Viejo in the city of Chinandega, in her convenience store, which she has set up in a room of her home where she offers different types of food and personal use products.

She has currently been able to stock her business and has done so with the help of Ceprodel credits, which she has invested in the purchase of merchandise for their sale. Today, she is applying once more for credit to buy supplies to for their sale and to continue maintaining her home.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

En el municipio de El Viejo de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Meris C. se dedica muy esforzadamente a laborar en su negocio de pulpería el cual atiende en su casa de habitación donde ofrece diferentes tipos de productos como comestibles y personales.

Hoy en día ha logrado surtir el negocio y lo ha realizado apoyándose de los créditos brindados por Ceprodel el cual los ha invertido para la compra de su mercadería para ofrecerla. Hoy solicita una vez mas el crédito para la compra de los materiales y así ofrecerlos y continuar manteniendo su hogar de habitación.

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is a married mother of three children, all of whom are currently in school. She is 42 years old and trades in charcoal, charcoal being a very popular source of energy for cooking in many traditional Ghanaian homes. Through this business, she has supported her first-born to complete senior high school.

Juliana obtains her supply of charcoal from the surrounding villages of Tema and sells it to her customers. She is seeking a loan to increase her stock of charcoal and expand her business. This will thereby increase her savings and provide for the educational needs of her children. She belongs to a community group called the Diamond Trust Group. In this group, members provide guarantees for one another and support one another in repaying the loan.

loans.use: To increase her stock of charcoal

loans.name: Karam

texts.en: Karam is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Kalbadjar region in Azerbaijan and he has settled in Khirdalan town. Ten years ago he started this business. He is married and has 3 children. He was born in 1956. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy goods for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy goods

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: La señora Teresa R., tiene 54años de edad, es casad tiene tres hijos, todos mayores edad,su esposo se dedica a la pesca, tiene lancha propia y trabaj en conjunto con sus hijos, la actividad economica de la señora es una pulperia con venta de Eskimo,  las aspieraciones de doña Teresa, es poder ampliar su negocio e invertir mas en inventario de esta manera fortalecer su inventario ya que en la actualidad no tiene un buen inventario capaz de cubrir la demanda del sector, sin embargo a traves del credito pretende ir mejorandolo, su negocio est aubicado en Salinas Grandes, donde habita, doña Teresa tiene 15 años de tener este negocio el cual da incio como ina vision de negocio ya que en donde habita se estaba aperturando un nuevo reparto y no habian negocios asi surge la idea de poner la puleria hasta llegar a ser lo que es la actualidad, donde ademas de ofrecer productos del hogar como arroz, azucar,aceite, leche y otros productos, tambien vende eskimos y pescado ya que su esposo es pescador. El credito le vendia a mejorar si inventario y satisfacer su demanda del sector.
texts.en:
Teresa is 54 years old and is married with three children, all adults. He husband makes a living fishing. He has his own motorboat and works with their children. Teresa runs a convenience store selling ice cream sandwiches and other items. Her aspirations are to grow her business and invest in more products, and in this way she can strengthen her inventory since she currently doesn't have enough selection to satisfy demand. Of course, through the loan she expects to keep making improvements. Her business is located in Salinas Grandes, where she lives, and she's been doing it for 15 years. The idea came to her after they opened up a new storefront where she lived and there were no businesses, so she thought of setting up the convenience store until she made it a reality. Along with offering household products like rice, sugar, oil, milk and other items, she also sells ice cream sandwiches and fish brought in by her husband. The loan will be used to improve her inventory to satisfy her customers demands.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in more inventory

loans.name: Nhoem

texts.en: Mrs. Nhoem S. was born in 1961 and now lives in Tjea village in Takeo Province. She owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Yem Yoeun, is a construction worker. They cannot earn much money to support their living conditions, even though two of their three children are working in a casino club. The youngest child is too young to work or study. Therefore Mrs. Nhoem S. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike to allow her husband to easily get to work. Her husband is on the right of photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to allow her husband to easily get to work.

loans.name: Odilhon

texts.ru: Хакимов Одилхон житель города Яван. Живет очень далеко от центра. Занимается животноводством уже 13 лет. обратился к нам за кредитом , для того, чтобы купить дополнительно еще одного бычка. Таким образом он увеличит поголовье скота. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Odilhon H. lives in Yavan, far away from the city center. He has been practicing animal husbandry for 13 years. He decided to obtain a loan to purchase an additional bull and increase livestock count. He will be able to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a bull

loans.name: Ngô Thị Mai Group

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị M. năm nay 38 tuổi Ms 020201060005 vay mức 5.152.000VNđ. Chị vay vốn về mua cám để nuôi lợn nái và đầu tư vào việc thu mua phế liệu. Chị là một phụ nữ rất năng động và chịu khó. Ngoài chăn nuôi, buôn bán ra, chị còn luôn giành thời gian để chăm sóc gia đình. Còn chồng chị là thợ xây dựng nên thu nhập của gia đình chị từ 130.000VNđ đến 150.000VNđ/ ngày. Chị có 2 con đang đi học, 1 con học cao đẳng và 1 con học phổ thông, nên chị rất thích tham gia hình thức vay vốn này để chị được trả dần và có kế hoạch tiết kiệm để nuôi con học.
 Trong nhóm chị có các tH.nh viên sau :
 Chị Chu Thị H. năm nay 42 tuổi Ms 020201060001 vay mức 5.152.000VNđ để chăn nuôi lợn.
 Chị Nguyễn Thị H. năm nay 33 tuổi Ms 020201060002 vay mức 4.256.000VNđ để xây chuồng trại.
 Chị Nguyễn Thị C. năm nay 32 tuổi Ms 020201060003 vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để thu mua phế liệu.
 Chị Mẫn Thị T. năm nay 46 tuổi Ms  020201060004 vay mức 4.256.000VNđ xây dựng chuồng trại, mở rộng chăn nuôi.
 Chị Mẫn Thị N. năm nay 31 tuổi Ms 020201060006 vay mức 4.256.000VNđ để mua gỗ sản xuất bàn ghế.
 Chị Mẫn Thị H. năm nay 50 tuổi Ms Ms 020201060007 vay mức 2.016000VNđ đê mua vịt.
 Chị Nguyễn Thị Hà năm nay 28 tuổi Ms Ms 020201060008 vay mức 2.016000VNđ để chăn nuôi lợn.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị M. is 38 years old. She is seeking a loan of 5,152,000 VND (304 USD) to buy bran and other waste materials to feed her pigs. She is a very energetic and industrious woman. In addition to raising and selling pigs, she always takes time to take care of her family as well. Her husband is a construction worker, so the family income is 130,000 VND to 150,000 VND (8 to 9 USD) per day. She has two children, one studying in junior college and one still in high school, so she is very eager to participate in this lending program in order to save money to pay for her children's education. Her group includes the following members: Mrs. Chu Thị H. is 42 years old. She is seeking a loan of 5,152,000 VND (304 USD) to raise pigs. Mrs. Nguyễn Thị H. is 33 years old. She is seeking a loan of 4,256,000 VND (251 USD) to build an animal enclosure. Mrs. Nguyễn Thị C. is 32 years old. She is seeking a loan of 4,704,000 VND (276 USD) to buy waste products to feed her pigs. Mrs. Mẫn Thị T. is 46 years old. She is seeking a loan of 4,256,000 VND (251 USD) to build an animal enclosure to expand the number of animals she can raise. Mrs. Mẫn Thị N. is 31 years old. She is seeking a loan of 4,256,000 VND (251 USD) to buy wood she will use to produce furniture. Mrs. Mẫn Thị H. is 50 years old. She is seeking a loan of 2,016,000 VND (119 USD) to buy ducks. Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Hà is 28 years old. She is seeking a loan of 2,016,000 VND (119 USD) to raise pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising pigs and ducks.  Furniture production.

loans.name: Enma Felicitas

texts.es:
Enma se dedica a la venta de menú dentro y fuera de su casa. Hace cinco años, cuando cambio de domicilio y después de que su hijo abriera una tienda en su casa, ella se animo a emprender un negocio ella también.

Gracias a que su domicilio está ubicado en una calle principal ella pensó en vender comida. Actualmente, no solo ofrece almuerzo dentro de su casa a modo de un pequeño restaurante sino también hace repartos a un determinado número de cliente. 

Ella cuenta con la ayuda de una sobrina y de vez en cuando de su esposo, quien junto a su hijo atienden y manejan una tienda de lubricantes para automóviles. Gracias a empeño, a su carisma y buena atención en el negocio de comida, Enma cuenta con muchos clientes, por lo que ella quisiera agrandar el espacio de su pequeño restaurante y convertirlo en cevichería.
texts.en:
Enma sell lunches inside and outside her home. Five years ago, when she changed homes and after her son opened a store in his house, Enma decided to undertake a business too.
Thanks to her home's location on a main street, Enma thought about selling food. These days, not only does Enma offer lunch inside her house (which she runs as a small restaurant), but also makes home deliveries to a certain number of customers.
Enma is assisted by her niece and occasionally by her husband, who alongside her son runs an automotive lubricants store. Thanks to her commitment, charisma, and attentiveness in the restaurant business, Enma has many customers, so she would like to enlarge the space of her small restaurant and make it a cevichería (a restaurant that sells ceviche).

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve her restaurant

loans.name: Musurmonkul

texts.en:
Musurmonkul A. works in agriculture. For this, he leaves his home to head for his distant farmlands that he must care for and fertilize at certain times. He has been farming for the past 7 years. He learned all the secrets and experiences of farming from his father. He tells us that, beyond the hard work, he does everything for the good of his family.

Musurmonkul is asking for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuel and lubricants with the goal that, in the coming harvest, he will have good quality, profitable products. Musurmonkul hopes that you can meet his request for the good of his agricultural production.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds, fertilizer, fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en: Priscilla O. is 31 years old and is married with 4 children. She sells sarongs and clothes. She is requesting a loan amount of 150,000 NGN to purchase more sarongs and clothes to sell. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase sarongs and clothes

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca B. is married and has four dependents. She has received schooling through junior high. Rebecca sells footwear and soap at Kisi near Elmina, which she has done since 1999. Her husband is a taxi driver. Rebecca uses her income to assist her husband with the housekeeping expenses.

Rebecca will use the loan as additional capital to enable her to increase her sales of footwear and soap to meet the increase in demand of her costumers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rebecca plans to save toward a house she wants to put up with her husband.

loans.use: Additional capital to increase sales of footwear and soap

loans.name: Arubaine C Group

texts.en: Mrs. Robina M. is 40 years old. She is married and has 13 children who all go to school. She has been in business for four years. She is using the loan to purchase dry fish. Being active and hard working, she now buys in large quantities and she wants to fulfill her goals of educating her children and buying a plot of land.

loans.use: Purchases dry fish in large quantities

loans.name: Olimchon

texts.ru: Олимчон работает в колхозе рядовым работником. Ему 57 лет, женат. Даже по меркам вотсока он считается многодетным отцом – у него 6 детей. Старшие выросли и уже помогают отцу и матери. Кроме работы в колхозе Олимчон еще занимается откормом скота. Сейчас у него есть несколько голов крупного рогатого скота и баранов. За ними ухаживают его жена и старшие дочери (на фото его старшая дочь). Олимчон дополнительно собирается приобрести еще одного бычка и корм для него. Недавно он подал заявку на КИВА.
texts.en:
Olimchon works in a collective farm as a common worker. He is 57 years old, he is married. Even by the middle eastern standards he is considered a father of many children - he has six. His older children have already grown up and are helping their mother and father. Beside his job at the farm Olimchon also feeds cattle. Right now he has several heads of cattle and sheep. His wife and older daughters are taking care of the cattle (his older daughter is on the photo). Additionally, Olimchon plans to buy one more calf and fodder. He has recently applied for a loan at Kiva.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a calf and fodder

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.en:
H. Phạm Thị (1433040719) is a 49-year-old female living in the town of Quảng Xương. She is widowed and has two school-aged children.

H. raises cattle for sale and has just started operating this business, earning approximately 200,000 VND a month.

In 2004, H. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell.

H. is now requesting a new loan of 7,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be her 3rd loan from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: San Luis De Huancapi Group

texts.en:
The members of the “San Luis de Huancapi” are from the district of Huancapi, Province of Victor Fajardo, which is located 4 hours outside the city of Ayacucho. The principle activities of the region are raising livestock, commercial enterprise and agriculture. 

Ana is a single mother of an 8-year-old son. Ana has a store in her house where she sells basic groceries. She also sells gelatin desserts that she makes herself. She needs a loan of 200 soles that she will invest in buying groceries. Ana’s dream is to expand her business and she dreams that her son will become a professional.

Alicia lives with her partner and she does not have children. Alicia sells cosmetics from catalogs. Alicia needs a loan of 200 soles to invest in a new business of making picarones (sweets made with flour and sweet potato). Alicia’s dream is of expanding her business and having a pharmacy.

Georgina lives with her parter and she has three children. Georgina sells gasoline in her district, a business that she has developed little by little.
